北京（路透社）-杨忠毅的儿子张长春告诉路透社，在她开始出现发烧症状两周后，她仍在等待周一在中国城市武汉进行的冠状病毒检测，尽管医生私下告诉她的家人，她几乎肯定已经被感染。
53岁的杨只是武汉许多居民中的一员，他们发现这种新型冠状病毒很难接受检测或治疗。当局说，在中国，这种病毒已经感染了2800人，造成至少80人死亡，这种情况可能是导致这种疾病蔓延的原因。
她的儿子说，杨一直无法获得全日制住院治疗。他说，为了治疗她日益恶化的肺部，她已经在该市四家独立医院的未隔离区滴了点滴，同时他正在尽全力让她接受全职检查或入院治疗。
“我和弟弟每天都在医院排队。我们早上6点和7点去，排了一整天的队，但是我们没有得到任何新的答案。“每次回答都是一样的：‘没有床，等政府通知，跟着新闻看情况。’医生们也都很沮丧。”
官方称为2019 nCoV的新型冠状病毒于1月10日在武汉首次被确定为一名61岁男子的死因，当时中国与其他国家分享了该病毒的基因信息。一些国家，如日本和泰国，在三天内就开始对来自中国的旅行者进行病毒检测。
然而，湖北省疾病预防控制中心（湖北省疾控中心）的一位官员告诉路透社记者，武汉的一些医院直到1月20日才分发这种疾病的检测试剂盒
. 据武汉市卫生局介绍，在此之前，样品必须送到北京的一个实验室进行检测，这个过程需要3到5天才能得到结果。
根据路透社从武汉市卫生局收集的数据，在这段时间里，武汉市的医院将接受医疗观察的人数从739人减少到82人，而且在中国国内没有新病例报告。
尽管武汉缺乏可靠的数据和检测能力，但中国当局在病毒被确认后的几天向市民保证，病毒不会广泛传播。在前几周，它审查了网上关于这一情况的负面评论，并逮捕了8名被指控为“谣言传播者”的人
“医生没有戴口罩，我们不知道如何保护自己。。。没有人告诉我们任何事情，”一位45岁的陈姓妇女告诉路透社。她的阿姨在住院五天后，即1月20日被证实感染了病毒。“我把阿姨的照片贴在（中国社交媒体网站）微博上，警察打电话给医院有关部门。他们叫我把它取下来。”
国家、地区和城市卫生官员没有回应路透社关于如何处理病毒爆发的评论请求。国家官员在上周的一次媒体吹风会上确实表示，在最初的治疗方法上存在一些“漏洞”。
武汉市长周先旺周一对中国国家电视台表示，他承认“各方对我们的信息披露不满意”，但他指出，省和国家领导人对他提出了严厉的要求。
他说：“在地方治理中，我收到信息后，只有在获得授权后才能发布。周小川在周日的一次媒体吹风会上说，根据尚待检测的患者人数，武汉市可能还有1000人被确诊感染了这种病毒
.
中国上周在湖北省实施了有记录以来最大规模的隔离行动，并正在建设两所新医院来治疗病毒患者。习近平总统成立了一个专门委员会来应对疫情。
该国因快速测序病毒基因而受到国际赞誉。然而，其缓慢的测试规模受到质疑。
约翰霍普金斯大学健康安全中心的高级学者阿梅什·阿达尔贾说，一旦确定了病毒，“你需要确保你有所有的试剂（化学分析中使用的一种物质）样本，并且你已经把它们都推到了你想测试的地方，世卫组织重点关注新出现的传染病和大流行防备。
尽管来自该地区的信息很少，但阿达尔贾认为，中国在应对疫情的这一阶段遇到了问题。他说：“我们已经听说那里缺少医疗专业人员，缺少测试包和药品。”。
伦敦卫生与热带医学院传染病数学建模中心教授约翰埃德蒙兹（John Edmunds）表示，中国在首次疫情爆发后，还没有传达足够详细的数据。
他对路透社说：“我们对事态的了解非常不完整。“我不知道这是不称职、保密还是故意的，但如果我们能有一些基本的流行病学数据，这将非常有用。”
检测物资短缺和中国最初的沉默招致批评，认为中国仍在从2002年爆发的导致近800人死亡的严重急性呼吸系统综合症（SARS）中吸取教训
.
密歇根大学中国研究中心负责人、政治学教授玛丽·加拉格尔说：“这些改进都是在硬科学方面——找出病毒的基因组，在接到通知后立即建立新医院——而不是在管理信息和与人打交道的软科学方面。”。
城市管理者没有动力将问题升级到政治上级。在湖北没有新的病毒病例报告的这一周，正值农历新年和省人大、政协会议的筹备工作。
湖北省疾控中心官员说，武汉最大的7家医院目前都配备了病毒检测试剂盒，理论上一天内就能出结果。
但4人对路透社表示，他们被拒绝接受检测，因为这一过程涉及一个复杂的报告系统，包括医院、区和市卫生局以及疾病控制官员。
武汉市疾病预防控制中心的一位官员告诉路透社记者，患者要符合一定的标准，比如有发烧和肺炎的症状，患者激增意味着“不可能马上进行检测”。
三名医院和当地政府工作人员听取了医生如何处理检查和确认病例的简报，他们告诉路透社，官方公布的感染和死亡人数并不能反映实际死亡人数。
一名医院工作人员告诉路透社记者，武汉市卫生部门对检测有限制，主要是因为检测试剂盒短缺，他们正在筛选患者名单，然后再决定谁接受检测，这需要几个小时。
这位工作人员告诉路透社：“一些重病患者被排除在最后的检查名单之外，因为他们知道自己将无法接受治疗。”。“实际死亡人数更高。”
路透社无法独立证实这名医院工作人员的说法
. 湖北和武汉卫生部门没有回应路透社的置评请求。
张的母亲仍在等待检查，她说武汉三家医院的医生私下告诉她的家人，他们几乎可以肯定她感染了冠状病毒。
不过，他说，其中两家医院告诉他，他们没有配备检测试剂盒，另一家医院告诉他，医院没有床位供他母亲进行检测。
这些医院都没有回复路透社的置评请求。
现年69岁的徐恩恩（音译）的女儿告诉路透社记者，他从1月8日开始发烧并肺部感染，武汉6家医院表示已经没有床位，因此拒绝接受检查。徐的症状最近恶化了，他开始呼吸困难。
他女儿在微博上公布了自己的病情后，他终于在1月22日住进武汉汉口医院排队接受检查。
兰开斯特大学的研究人员估计，武汉只有5.1%的感染被确认。截至1月21日，他们估计今年年初以来武汉共有11341人感染。据武汉市卫生部门统计，目前武汉有3万多人在接受观察。
“我们只想确认这个病例是否是病毒，”一位33岁的武汉刘姓妇女说，她的父亲从1月14日起就在医院戴着呼吸器，周一还没有接受测试。“至少如果确认我们有方向。如果没有方向，就没有希望。”

news_title_translate_en: CORRECTED-WRAPUP 13-Cruise line bans China citizens; Outrage as doctor who sounded coronavirus alarm dies
news_title_translate_cn: 更正-wrappup13游轮禁止中国公民乘坐；听到冠状病毒警报的医生死亡
news_content_translate_en:
(Corrects spelling of Global Times editor’s name in 16th paragraph)
* Doctor who died had been reprimanded by police
* U.S. sends 18 tons of donated medical supplies
* WHO warns against racial stigma over virus
By Se Young Lee and Brenda Goh
BEIJING/SHANGHAI, Feb 7 (Reuters) - A major cruise line on Friday took the extraordinary step of banning citizens of China regardless of when they were last there, while there was sorrow and anger over the coronavirus death of a doctor from Wuhan who had been reprimanded for sounding an early warning about the disease.
The death of Li Wenliang, 34, came as President Xi Jinping reassured the United States and the World Health Organization (WHO) of transparency and maximum effort to combat the virus.
Beijing’s communist leadership has sealed off cities, cancelled flights and closed factories to limit an epidemic roiling the world’s second-biggest economy, with ripple effects felt by global markets and businesses dependent on Chinese supply lines.
The epicentre province of Hubei and its capital Wuhan are in lockdown, and Beijing resembles a ghost town.
Apple Inc, however, said it was working to reopen its China corporate offices and call centres next week, and was making preparations to reopen retail stores there.
After two days in which Hubei reported fewer new cases of coronavirus and deaths, spurring some optimism, there was an uptick on Friday.
The Hubei health commission website reported 82 new deaths and 2,841 new cases in the province, taking the mainland China totals to more than 700 deaths and over 34,000 infections
WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, speaking in Geneva, had cautioned earlier that “the numbers could go up again,” and warned of worldwide shortages of gowns, masks and other protective equipment
.
Global equity markets and government debt yields slumped on Friday, as growing concerns about the virus’ impact on global growth overshadowed a strong U.S. jobs report.
U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo on Friday said the United States was prepared to spend up to $100 million to assist China and support coronavirus efforts by the WHO.
The United States has sent nearly 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China, including masks, gowns and respirators, a State Department official said.
The WHO said out of $675 million it is seeking for its coronavirus response through April, it has received pledges of $110 million, $100 million of that from the Gates Foundation.
Ophthalmologist Li was among eight people reprimanded by police in Wuhan, which has suffered the brunt of the outbreak since the virus emerged there, for spreading “illegal and false” information.
Li was made to sign a letter saying he had “severely disrupted social order” and was threatened with charges.
Social media users called him a hero and shared a selfie of him lying on a hospital bed wearing an oxygen respirator and holding up his Chinese identification card. One image showed the message “farewell Li Wenliang” etched into snow on a riverbank.
“Wuhan indeed owes Li Wenliang an apology,” said Hu Xijin, editor of the government-backed Global Times tabloid.
Rights group Amnesty International called his death a “tragic reminder” of how China’s preoccupation with stability made it suppress vital information.
China had been accused of trying to cover up the 2003 SARS outbreak that killed almost 800 people worldwide.
There were signs that discussion of Li’s death was being censored. After briefly trending on Weibo, the topics “the Wuhan government owes doctor Li Wenliang an apology” and “we want free speech” yielded no search results.
The virus has spread around the world, with 320 cases now in 27 countries and regions outside mainland China, a Reuters tally of official statements showed
.
WHO emergency expert Mike Ryan said reports of Asians being shunned in the West over a perceived connection to coronavirus was “utterly and completely unacceptable and it needs to stop.”
Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd issued a statement on Friday saying: “Any guest or crewmen traveling from, to, or through mainland China, Hong Kong or Macau less than 15 days prior to their sailing will be unable to board any of our ships.”
But it did not stop there. It also said, “Any guests holding a Chinese, Hong Kong or Macau passport, regardless of when they were there last, will not be allowed to board our ships.”
China has complained bitterly about bans and measures that go against WHO recommendations and accused governments and companies that take such actions of fear mongering.
Two deaths have been reported outside mainland China, in Hong Kong and the Philippines, but how deadly and contagious the virus is remains unclear, prompting countries to quarantine hundreds of people and cut travel links with China.
Four sick passengers aboard a Royal Caribbean ship that arrived off New Jersey in the United States were sent to a hospital out of “an abundance of caution,” the local mayor said.
There were 41 new cases among about 3,700 people quarantined in a cruise ship off Japan, taking the total to 61, while Chinese-ruled Hong Kong quarantined for a third day a cruise ship with 3,600 on board.
“A cruise ship is a very particular environment in which you can have higher levels of transmission even with a virus that isn’t very efficient at transmission,” WHO’s Ryan told a news conference in Geneva.
The head of the Beijing Municipal Bureau of Justice, Li Fuying, told reporters that people deliberately concealing contacts or refusing isolation could be punished with death.
news_content_translate_cn:
（更正了《环球时报》编辑姓名在第16段中的拼写）
*死去的医生受到警方的训斥
*美国捐赠18吨医疗用品
*世卫组织警告不要因病毒而受到种族歧视
作者：Se Young Lee和Brenda Goh
路透北京/上海2月7日-周五，一家大型游轮公司采取了非同寻常的措施，禁止中国公民入境，无论他们最后一次是什么时候，同时，武汉一名医生因对该病发出预警而受到训斥，他因冠状病毒死亡而感到悲伤和愤怒。
34岁的李文亮去世时，习近平总统向美国和世界卫生组织保证了透明度和最大努力来对抗病毒。
中国共产党领导层封锁了城市，取消了航班，关闭了工厂，以控制这场席卷全球第二大经济体的流行病，全球市场和依赖中国供应线的企业都感受到了连锁反应。
震中的湖北省及其首都武汉已被封锁，北京就像一个鬼城。
不过，苹果公司（Apple Inc）表示，正在努力于下周重新开放其在华公司办公室和呼叫中心，并正准备在那里重新开设零售店。
两天后，湖北省报告的新发冠状病毒病例和死亡病例减少，激发了一些乐观情绪，周五出现上升。
湖北省卫生委员会网站报道了该省82例新死亡和2841例新病例，中国大陆死亡总数超过700人，感染人数超过34000人
世卫组织总干事特德罗斯·阿德南姆·盖布雷耶苏早些时候在日内瓦发表讲话时曾警告说，“这一数字可能再次上升”，并警告说，全球范围内的礼服、口罩和其他防护设备短缺
.
全球股市和政府债券收益率周五大幅下挫，因对病毒对全球经济增长影响的担忧加剧，盖过了美国强劲的就业报告。
U、 美国国务卿蓬佩奥（Mike Pompeo）周五表示，美国准备斥资至多1亿美元帮助中国，并支持世卫组织的冠状病毒工作。
美国国务院一名官员说，美国已经向中国运送了近17.8吨医疗用品，包括口罩、长袍和呼吸器。
世卫组织表示，在截至4月份寻求冠状病毒应对措施的6.75亿美元中，已收到盖茨基金会1.1亿美元的认捐，其中1亿美元来自盖茨基金会。
武汉自病毒爆发以来首当其冲受到警方谴责的8人中就有眼科医生李，他传播“非法和虚假”信息。
李被要求在一封信上签字，说他“严重扰乱了社会秩序”，并受到指控的威胁。
社交媒体用户称他为英雄，并分享了他躺在病床上戴着氧气呼吸器、举着中国身份证的自拍。一张图片显示了刻在河岸上的雪地上的“告别李文良”的信息。
“武汉确实欠李文良一个道歉，”政府支持的《环球时报》的编辑胡锡进说。
人权组织大赦国际（Amnesty International）称，他的死是“悲剧性的提醒”，说明中国对稳定的关注是如何使其压制重要信息的。
中国被指控试图掩盖2003年在全球造成近800人死亡的SARS疫情。
有迹象表明，有关李死的讨论正在被审查。在微博上短暂风行之后，“武汉政府欠李文良医生一个道歉”和“我们要言论自由”的话题都没有搜索结果。
路透社的官方声明显示，该病毒已经在全球传播，目前在中国大陆以外的27个国家和地区有320例病例
.
世卫组织紧急情况专家迈克·瑞安说，有关亚洲人在西方被认为与冠状病毒有关而遭到回避的报道“完全不能接受，必须停止”
皇家加勒比海游轮公司星期五发表声明说：“在航行之前或不到15天的时间内，任何从中国大陆、香港大陆或澳门出发的旅客或船员都无法登上我们的任何船只。”
但它并没有就此止步。它还说：“任何持有中国护照、香港护照或澳门护照的客人，不管他们最后一次到哪里，都不允许登上我们的船。”
中国对违反世卫组织建议的禁令和措施表示强烈不满，并指责采取此类行动的政府和企业散布恐惧。
据报道，在中国大陆、香港和菲律宾以外有两人死亡，但病毒的致命性和传染性尚不清楚，促使各国对数百人进行隔离，并切断与中国的旅游联系。
当地市长说，一艘从美国新泽西州驶离的加勒比皇家轮船上的四名患病乘客被送往医院是出于“高度谨慎”。
在日本附近的一艘邮轮中，大约3700人被隔离，共有41例新病例，占总数的61，而中国则裁定香港在船上隔离了第三天，船上有3600艘。
瑞安在日内瓦的一个新闻发布会上说：“游轮是一个非常特殊的环境，在这种环境中，即使病毒的传播效率不是很高，你也可以有更高的传播水平。”。
北京市司法局局长李福英告诉记者，故意隐瞒联系或者拒绝隔离的人可能会被处以死刑。

news_title_translate_en: Japan confirms three more citizens evacuated from Wuhan test positive for coronavirus
news_title_translate_cn: 日本证实从武汉撤离的另外三名市民冠状病毒检测呈阳性
news_content_translate_en:
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan confirmed an additional three cases of the new coronavirus among evacuees from the Chinese city of Wuhan, including one who initially tested negative, the health ministry said on Saturday, bringing the country’s total to 20 cases.
One of the three, a man in his 40s who had symptoms such as fever and coughing, first tested negative for coronavirus, the ministry said. But the man, who was initially diagnosed with pneumonia, later confirmed positive for the virus with an additional test, it said.
The government plans to send another chartered plane mid-week or later to bring back Japanese nationals who are still in China’s Hubei province and its capital Wuhan, where the disease is thought to have originated, the foreign ministry said on Sunday.
Japan has emailed its citizens in the province to tell them of its plan, and is negotiating with China about Chinese spouses of Japanese citizens who also wish to travel to Japan, it said.
China is facing mounting isolation amid increasing international travel curbs and flight suspensions as the death toll from the coronavirus outbreak rose to 259.
Japan on Saturday moved to contain the economic impact of the outbreak as strict new measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus came into effect.
news_content_translate_cn:
东京（路透社）-日本卫生部星期六说，在中国武汉市的撤离人员中，日本确认了另外三例新的冠状病毒感染病例，其中一人最初检测呈阴性，使日本的病例总数达到20例。
卫生部说，其中一名40多岁的男子有发烧和咳嗽等症状，他首先被检测出冠状病毒阴性。但据报道，这名男子最初被诊断为肺炎，后来通过附加检测证实病毒呈阳性。
日本外务省周日表示，政府计划在本周中或晚些时候再派一架包机，把仍在中国湖北省及其首府武汉的日本国民带回中国，武汉被认为是这种疾病的发源地。
报道称，日本已向该省公民发送电子邮件，告知其计划，并正与中国就日本公民的中国配偶问题进行谈判，这些中国公民也希望前往日本。
随着冠状病毒疫情死亡人数升至259人，中国面临越来越多的国际旅行限制和航班停飞，中国正面临与世隔绝的局面。
日本周六采取行动遏制疫情对经济的影响，旨在限制病毒传播的严格新措施开始生效。

news_title_translate_en: The director general went to China to discuss new coronavirus outbreaks
news_title_translate_cn: 世卫总干事去中国商讨新型冠状病毒疫情
news_content_translate_en:
Reuters news agency, Tan Desai said on Sunday night that he hoped to strengthen the partnership with China and provide further support to China in the fight against the epidemic. Tan Desai said that the chief editor of several major scientific journals agreed that after the author's permission, he would share with the World Health Organization all the research results of the new coronavirus, so that the world health organization could evaluate the new virus and issue relevant policies.
After the first European case of coronavirus pneumonia in France, the European Regional Office of the World Health Organization said that every country needs to be prepared to detect and manage any type of epidemic in time.
France officially announced three confirmed cases of new coronavirus pneumonia on Friday to the European Regional Office of the World Health Organization, two in Paris, together in Bordeaux. The patients are all from Wuhan and are now hospitalized in France.
The European Regional Office of the World Health Organization says that the first case of new coronavirus pneumonia diagnosed in Europe is not unexpected. It reminds us that the global nature of travel will not allow any country to be affected by the spread of infectious diseases. It also means that no country can delay the establishment of all necessary measures to protect its people.
The European Regional Office of the World Health Organization commends France for its ability to quickly identify and diagnose 2019 suspected cases of new coronavirus pneumonia. The office noted that the fact that health-care workers in France who care for patients are reminded to identify symptoms and investigate the patient's travel history contributes to rapid and effective action. The office stressed that this is the cornerstone for health professionals to participate in the preparation, response and effective control of the epidemic.
The WHO Regional Office for Europe says timely action is essential for early containment, as is France's rapid notification to who and rapid public communication, as well as global collaboration and solidarity.
The regional office for Europe said that at a time when the origin and behavior of the virus were uncertain, it was more important for countries, organizations and the international community to work together. We need to act as a region, as a world, to enhance our ability to prepare and respond together. This includes preparing at the local and national levels to test patients, test samples of suspected infected people, fully manage patients, control infection to the maximum extent, maintain open communication with the public and transparent information sharing as the basis of knowledge and action
。
The regional office for Europe said it was not clear how the epidemic would develop, but there was a window of opportunity and we must seize it to make our region and the world safer.
news_content_translate_cn:
路透社消息，谭德塞周日晚表示，希望强化与中国的伙伴关系，在抗击此次疫情向中国进一步提供保障支援。谭德塞表示，多份主要科学刊物的主编已同意，在作者允许后，将会与世卫分享有关新型冠状病毒的所有研究成果，以便世卫能够对新型病毒作出评估并发出相关政策。
在法国出现欧洲首例新型冠状病毒肺炎病例之后，世卫组织欧洲区域办事处表示，每个国家都需要做好准备，及时发现和管理任何类型的疫情。
法国周五向世卫组织欧洲区域办事处正式通报了三起新型冠状病毒肺炎确诊病例两起在巴黎，一起在波尔多。病人都来自武汉，现在在法国住院治疗。
世卫组织欧洲区域办事处表示，在欧洲出现确诊的首例新型冠状病毒肺炎病例并不出人意料，它们提醒我们，旅行的全球性不会让任何国家免受传染病传播的影响。这也意味着没有一个国家能够推迟建立保护其人民的所有必要措施。
世卫组织欧洲区域办事处并赞扬法国快速识别和诊断2019新型冠状病毒肺炎疑似病例的能力。该办事处指出，法国护理病人的卫生保健人员被提醒识别症状并调查病人旅行史，这一事实有助于迅速有效地采取行动。该办事处强调，这是卫生专业人员参与疫情准备和应对、进行有效控制的基石。
世卫组织欧洲区域办事处表示，及时采取行动对于早期遏制至关重要，法国迅速通知世卫组织和快速进行公共沟通就是一个例子，这也是全球协作和团结的一个例子。
欧洲区域办事处表示，在一个病毒起源和行为方式不确定的时刻，各国、各组织和国际社会齐心协力更为重要。我们需要作为一个地区、一个世界来行动，以增强共同准备和应对的能力。这包括在地方和国家两个层面做好准备，以检测病人，检测疑似感染者的样本，充分管理病人，最大限度地控制感染，并保持与公众的公开沟通以及作为知识和行动基础的透明信息共享。
欧洲区域办事处表示，现在还不知道疫情将如何发展，但目前具有一个机会之窗，我们必须抓住它，使所在地区和世界更加安全。

news_title_translate_en: Wuhan pneumonia: improvement of patients in Bazhou, Germany
news_title_translate_cn: 武汉肺炎：德国巴州患者病情好转
news_content_translate_en:
On its website, the German government warned Germans not to travel to Hubei, the epicenter of the epidemic. Germany's foreign ministry also issued a travel warning on Tuesday.
According to the German times weekly, the German government is ready to withdraw overseas Chinese from Hubei. A transport plane from the Bundeswehr air force is on standby. But which city will fly to China? How many uninfected Germans will be evacuated? Specific actions need to be discussed with China.
On Tuesday evening, the city's Ministry of health confirmed that another suspected patient had appeared in Berlin, and officials seriously suspected that the woman had Wuhan pneumonia, n-tv reported. The inspection results will be available within 24 hours. On Saturday, Bild reported that there was a suspected patient in Berlin, but Sunday's examination showed that the patient only had a common cold.
N-tv also reported that the condition of the infected people in Bazhou had improved. Clemens wendtner, chief physician at Schwabing hospital who treated the patient, said: "the patient has no fever and no symptoms of respiratory infection." Doctors are almost certain that the patient's life is no longer in danger. When a Chinese female colleague came to Bazhou for vocational training, she passed on Wuhan pneumonia to her colleague. The female colleague was found to have Wuhan pneumonia after feeling unwell during her flight back to China. 40 colleagues and family members of Webasto auto parts manufacturing company who have contact with Chinese female colleagues are currently under observation and asked not to leave their houses. Experts estimate that the number of people infected in Bazhou may increase.
But the German government says it is ready to fight the coronavirus. The risk of Wuhan pneumonia spreading in Germany is small. German Health Minister Stephen Spang warned people not to panic.
news_content_translate_cn:
德国政府在其网页上警告德国人尽量不要前往疫情中心湖北地区旅行。德国外交部周二也发出了旅行警告。
据德国《时代》周报报道，德国政府已做好了从湖北撤侨的准备。德国联邦国防军空军部的一架运输飞机已在待命起飞。但将飞往中国哪个城市？将撤出多少未受感染的德国人？具体行动还需和中方磋商。
N-TV电视台报道说，周二傍晚，柏林市卫生部确认，柏林又出现了一起疑似患者，而且官方严重怀疑这位妇女患的是武汉肺炎。24小时内可获悉检查结果。上周六，《图片报》报道，柏林出现了一起疑似患者，但上周日检查结果证明，患者只是患有普通感冒。
N-TV电视台还报道说，巴州被感染者病情已有所好转。Schwabing 医院治疗该病人的主治大夫Clemens Wendtner表示：“患者不发烧，也没有呼吸道感染症状了。”医生几乎肯定地表示，患者已没有生命危险。一位中国女同事来巴州接受职业培训时，将武汉肺炎传给了这位同事。这位女同事在飞回中国的旅途中，感觉身体不适，后被查出染有武汉肺炎。Webasto汽车零部件生产企业和中国女同事有接触的40名同事和家属目前都在接受观察，并被要求不要离开自己的住房。专家估计，巴州受感染者人数可能还会增加。
但德国政府表示，德国做好了抗击冠状病毒的准备。武汉肺炎在德国蔓延的风险很小。德国卫生部长斯潘警告人们不要惊慌。

news_title_translate_en: Australia forbids any foreigner who has come to China
news_title_translate_cn: 澳大利亚禁止任何到过中国人的外国人入境
news_content_translate_en:
The U.S. government has banned foreigners who have been in China for two weeks. The United States also restricts all Chinese flights to seven designated airports. Following the United States, Australia announced on Saturday that it would ban from February 1 any foreigners who have been to China or those who have transferred flights in China to prevent the spread of new pneumonia in Australia. As for Australian citizens, if they return from China, they can enter the country, but they should be isolated.
According to Chinese officials, as of Saturday, the new coronavirus epidemic has caused 259 deaths in China. At present, many countries have offered travel restrictions and suspension of flights to and from China. The outbreak of pneumonia in Wuhan has also led to the intensification of overseas Chinese evacuation, especially from Hubei Province and its capital, Wuhan. China, the world's second largest economy, is facing the risk of accelerated growth slowdown.
Delta announced on Saturday that it would speed up its suspension of flights from the United States to and from China. Delta Air Lines originally planned to suspend all flights to China from February 6 to April 30. But delta said Saturday that the last flights to China will take off on February 1, and the last flights from China will leave on February 2.
Three major American Airlines, including United Airlines holdings and American Airlines Group, have announced the cancellation of flights to China.
Qantas and New Zealand also suspended direct flights to mainland China. Nordic also suspended flights to and from Beijing and Shanghai this month.
New pneumonia has spread to at least 24 countries and regions around the world. Some countries prohibit Chinese citizens and Hong Kong people from entering the country. Kuwait prohibits the entry of passport holders from China or the Hong Kong SAR. Italy has suspended all flights to and from Hong Kong and Macao, China.
The government of India has banned the export of all kinds of personal protective equipment, including masks and protective clothing, from Saturday. There is a confirmed case of pneumonia in Wuhan in India. The patient, a female student at Wuhan University, has banned the export of personal protective equipment since Saturday in order to protect the country's epidemic prevention needs. Previously, the Indian government has sent chartered flights to Wuhan to pick up more than 300 detained Indians. The men were sent to a military run quarantine for two weeks. The Indian government plans to send another special plane to China to evacuate overseas Chinese
。
In addition, the central epidemic command center in Taiwan announced on Saturday that the spread of the new coronavirus epidemic to Guangdong province and the spread of the community were taken into account. From Sunday, the people of Guangdong could not enter Taiwan. At the same time, people who had been to Guangdong province and who had entered the country through small three links had to be segregated for 14 days at home.
Taiwan's command center said it decided to divide the mainland's epidemic areas into two levels after the expert consultation. At present, Hubei Province is listed as the first level epidemic area and Guangdong Province as the second level epidemic area, which shows that it is suspected that there is community communication in the local area.
According to Reuters, Kim Jeong-eun, the supreme leader of North Korea, sent a letter to Chinese President Xi Jinping to express condolences to the epidemic caused by the new coronavirus. North Korea decided to provide financial assistance to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
The Reuters quoted the Korean Central News Agency reported on Saturday that Kim Jeong-eun believed that under the guidance of Xi Jinping, "the Chinese Communist Party, the Chinese government and the Chinese people will be sure to win the battle against disease."
According to the decision made by the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the labor party, the Central Committee of the labor party will provide financial assistance to the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the report said.
The report also said that the Labor Party and the North Korean people regard the epidemic of infectious diseases in China as their own business, as a matter of family and flesh and blood, and convey to the Chinese side that North Korea is willing to share difficulties with the Chinese people.
Reuters reports that China is North Korea's closest ally in isolation. But with the outbreak of pneumonia in Wuhan, North Korea took the lead in cancelling most of its flights to China, enforcing quarantine on all people from China to North Korea, and strictly restricting border exchanges between the two countries.
news_content_translate_cn:
美国政府宣布，禁止两周内曾到中国外国人入境。美国同时限制所有中国航班要在指定七个机场升降。继美国后，澳大利亚周六宣布，2月1日起禁止任何到过中国的外国人或者曾在中国转机的人入境，以防止新肺炎疫情在澳洲扩散。至于澳大利亚本国公民如果从中国返国，可以入境，但要自我隔离。
据中国官方公布，截至到周六，新型冠状病毒疫情已在中国境内造成259人死亡。目前各国纷纷祭出旅游限制和暂停飞航往返中国班机。武汉肺炎疫情也导致各国加紧展开撤侨行动，尤其是自湖北省及其省会武汉，全球第2大经济体中国正面临增长加速放缓风险。
美国达美航空周六宣布，达美将加速执行暂停飞航自美国往返中国航班。达美航空（Delta Air Lines）原计划自2月6日至4月30日暂停所有飞中国航班。但达美周六表示，最后一批飞往中国班机将于2月1日起飞，自中国返航的最后一批班机则将于2日离开中国。
包括联合航空控股（United Airlines Holdings）和美国航空集团（American Airlines Group）在内的全美三大航空公司已宣布取消飞往中国的班机。
另外澳洲航空以及新西兰公司也暂停前往中国内地的直航班机。北欧航空本月也暂停来往北京及上海的航班。
新型肺炎扩散到全球至少二十四个国家及地区，部份国家禁止中国公民以及香港人入境。科威特禁止中国或香港特区护照特有人入境。意大利暂停所有来往中国香港及澳门的飞机航班。
印度政府宣布周六天起禁止包括口罩、防护衣等各种个人防护设备出口。印度有一宗武汉肺炎确诊个案。患者是一名在武汉大学读书的女学生，为保障国内防疫需求，印度周六起禁止出口个人防护设备。此前印度政府已派包机到武汉，接载300多名滞留的印度人返国。这些人被送往军方管理的隔离所接受为期两星期的隔离观察。印度政府计划派另一架专机前往中国撤侨。
另外，台湾的中央流行疫情指挥中心周六宣布，考虑到新型冠状病毒疫情蔓延到中国广东省并出现社区传播，周日起广东省民众不得入境台湾，同时曾到过广东省及透过小三通入境的人士必须在家居隔离14天。
台湾指挥中心表示，在召开专家咨询会后决定，将大陆流行地区划分为两级，目前湖北省列为一级流行地区，广东省列为二级流行地区，显示怀疑当地已有社区传播。
另据路透社消息，朝鲜最高领导人金正恩致函中国国家主席习近平，对新型冠状病毒引发的疫情表达慰问。朝鲜决定，向中共中央委员会提供资金援助。
路透社引述朝鲜中央通信社周六的报导，金正恩信中表示，在习近平指导下，“确信中国共产党、中国政府和中国人民在抗病作战中，必将赢得胜利”。
报导指出，根据劳动党中央委员会政治局做出的决定，劳动党中央委员会将向中国共称党中央委员会提供资金援助。
报导还称，劳动党和朝鲜人民将此次在中国出现的传染病疫情视为己事，当作一家人、亲骨肉遇到的事情，向中方转达朝鲜愿与中国人民有难同当之情。
路透社报导，中国是朝鲜在处境孤立下的最密切盟友。但随著武汉肺炎疫情爆发，朝鲜率先取消大部分飞往中国的班机，并对自中国入境朝鲜的所有人实施强制隔离，同时严格限制两国边境往来。

Too many trees: after this risk period, there will be more wild cats on the road
Call not to believe the rumor not to spread the rumor said: in fact, it is brain damage will not be infected.

据该报道引述网民意见：昨夜梦：这就是科学素养以及一些常识的缺失，很容易人云亦云，造成恐慌。但是愚昧的人民是统治者所喜欢的。gratesque：好可怜的猫。相伴万年来，又一次见识人类的愚蠢。甜玉米：还有人家里卖什么滞销的吗？捞智商税的时间到喽。

news_title_translate_en: Two cases of neonatal coronavirus in China
news_title_translate_cn: 中国发现两例新生儿患冠状病毒
news_content_translate_en:
Beijing, February 5 - Russia News Agency. According to a statement from the city's children's Hospital, two new types of coronavirus infections were found at the outbreak site in Wuhan.
The child was born on February 2, when the mother was diagnosed. Doctors tested the baby only 30 hours after birth to avoid affecting tests for various factors, including amniotic fluid. After the diagnosis, the child was transferred from Wuhan third level hospital to a special children's hospital to treat pneumonia, Caused by a new coronavirus.
At present, children are under constant supervision of doctors. Their main living indicators are stable, with no temperature or cough, but their breathing capacity is very high, X-ray showed pulmonary infection and liver dysfunction.
"This incident reminds us to pay special attention to the possibility of vertical mother to child transmission, a new form of coronavirus." -Zheng linkun, chief of Department of Neonatology, Wuhan children's Hospital, said.
The second child was born on January 13, when he was in good health.
About However, coronavirus was found on 22 January among women who took care of their mother before and after childbirth, and was diagnosed on 26 January. The mother also had vomiting, coughing and coughing. On 31 January, he was taken to a children's Hospital for treatment.
In this case, it is not clear who is ill - the mother or the child. However, doctors point out that special attention must be paid to all newborns and children who have been in contact with infected persons because they have not yet acquired immunity.
On December 31, 2019, Chinese authorities reported to the World Health Organization (who) that an unknown outbreak of pneumonia occurred in Wuhan, central China. Experts have found Colorado virus 2019 ncov. More than 2400 new infections have occurred in mainland China, 490 of them have died, and another has died in Hong Kong. More than 170 people were ill abroad, one of them dead. Who recognizes the international significance of an emergency.
news_content_translate_cn:
北京，2月5日-俄新社。据该市儿童医院的声明称，在爆发点武汉市发现了两起新类型的冠状病毒感染病例。
孩子2月2日出生，当时母亲已经确诊。医生只在孩子出生后30小时进行了化验，以避免对包括羊水在内的各种因素的检测产生影响。在确诊后，立即将该儿童从武汉第三级医院转到专门的儿童医院治疗肺炎，由一个新的冕状病毒引起的。
目前，儿童受到医生的不断监督，他的主要生活指标稳定，温度和咳嗽都没有，但呼吸量很高，X射线显示肺感染和肝功能失调。
“这一事件提醒我们特别注意新形式的冠状病毒——垂直母婴传播的可能性。”-武汉儿童医院新生儿科科长郑林坤认为。
第二个孩子出生于1月13日，当时身体健康。
♪♪但是，1月22日，在产前和产后照顾母亲的妇女中发现了Coronavirus，1月26日确诊，母亲也有呕吐、咳嗽和咳嗽。1月31日，他被送往儿童医院治疗。
在这种情况下，不清楚谁先生病-母亲或孩子。然而，医生指出，必须特别注意与被感染者接触过的所有新生儿和儿童，因为他们尚未获得免疫力。
中国当局于2019年12月31日向世界卫生组织（卫生组织）报告说，中国中部武汉市爆发了未知的肺炎。专家们发现了科罗拉多病毒2019-nCov。中国内地新增感染病例2400多人，490人死亡，另一人在香港死亡。170多人在国外生病，其中一人死亡。卫生组织认识到紧急情况的爆发具有国际意义。

news_title_translate_en: The second plane delivered 64 people from Wuhan to qiumingzhou
news_title_translate_cn: 第二架飞机向秋明州运送64名从武汉撤离的人
news_content_translate_en:
Yekaterinburg, Russian news agency, February 5. According to the Ministry of defense, the second plane landed at rosinotuming airport, with 64 Russians and other citizens evacuated from China due to the 2019 ncov outbreak in Colorado. They will be quarantined at the Qiuming Rehabilitation Center for two weeks. The doctor made it clear that all the arrivals were in a satisfactory condition and were not ill. A total of 128 Russians and 16 citizens of the CIS countries were transported from Wuhan, the epicenter of the outbreak of viral pneumonia. The passengers were accompanied by military medical personnel and virologists with advanced diagnosis, personal protection and essential drugs. "For the first time, the staff of the Qiuming health and quarantine station of the consumer protection agency of the Russian Federation boarded the plane, A survey of people with signs of disease was conducted. There was no sign of disease at the time of the examination. There was no complaint from the passenger. All passengers were fitted with contactless thermometers.

news_title_translate_en: Thailand to evacuate its citizens from Wuhan on Tuesday
news_title_translate_cn: 泰国将于周二撤离武汉市民
news_content_translate_en: By Linda KhooBANGKOK, 2 Feb -- Thailand is set to evacuate its citizens stranded in Wuhan, the epicentre of the 2019 novel coronavirus  (2019-nCoV) outbreak, on Tuesday. Deputy Prime Minister and Public Health Minister Anutin Chanvirakul said eight medical officers including doctors, epidemiologist, psychiatrist and nurses would be onboard the AirAsia Thailand plane to monitor their health. “Upon their return, they will be examined and quarantined for 14 days before they allowed to return home,” he told a media conference here today.  So far, 106 Thais in Wuhan and 161 in Hubei province have been identified with about 140 of them have registered to return to home. Thailand’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs is coordinating with the Royal Thai Embassy in Beijing and Thai consulate in Wuhan to secure a passage home for its citizens wanting to return.  The Ministry of Public Health will be responsible for taking care of all officers’ health, both accompanying airport staff and Thais living in Wuhan with the highest international standards on screening, disease prevention and control to ensure the safety of all people after returning from China.Anutin said all returning Thais would be screened to ensure they were symptom-free before boarding the plane for home. “At least three locations have been identified as a quarantine centre and Prime Minister General Prayuth Chan o-cha will decide on the final location,”  he said. At present, there are 19 confirmed 2019 novel coronavirus cases in Thailand, including two locals with the first human-to-human transmission reported on Jan 31 where a taxi driver became the first patient to contract the infection inside the kingdom.So far eight of the patients have recovered and discharged from hospitals with a statement from the Public Health Ministry saying from 3 Jan to 1 Feb the total number of patients under investigation (PUI) rose to 382 people. It said most of the PUI were infected with seasonal influenza, and 311 PUI cases were admitted at hospitals. Director of the Division of Communicable Diseases Dr Sopon Lamsirithaworn said there has been no report of new cases and one of the confirmed cases of novel coronavirus has recovered and discharged from hospital.  -- BERNAMA

news_title_translate_en: Three more suspected 2019-nCoV cases awaiting results of lab tests - Dr Dzulkefly
news_title_translate_cn: 又有三起疑似2019例nCoV病例等待实验室检测结果-哲尔克弗利博士
news_content_translate_en: PUTRAJAYA, Jan 28 -- As at noon today, three more new cases of suspected 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) are awaiting laboratory test results, said Health Minister Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad.He said the three cases, all involving Chinese nationals, were received within the past 24 hours.“Out of the three persons under investigation (PUI), two cases are in Langkawi and one in Bintulu.“All the three cases involved China nationals,” he told reporters after a special meeting to discuss issues on the coronavirus outbreak, chaired by the Minister of Tourism, Arts and Culture Datuk Mohamaddin Ketapi here today.Dr Dzulkefly said the results of the laboratory test on five other cases reported last Monday, two of which were in Langkawi, two in Kuala Lumpur and one in Bintulu, had come back negative.The number of positive cases of 2019-nCoV in Malaysia currently remains at four, with all involving China nationals, he said.Dr Dzulkefly said the coronavirus cases in Malaysia were identified through two methods - close contacts with someone positive with the 2019-nCoV, and showing symptoms of suspected coronavirus infection and become a PUI.Of the four positive cases, he said, three were identified through close contacts, and the other was a PUI case.So far, he said there were 65 PUI for coronavirus in Malaysia, 34 of whom were Malaysian citizens, 30 were China nationals and one Jordanian.One of the 65 PUI was tested positive for 2019-nCoV, three still awaiting lab test results and 61 others were tested negative.When asked whether Malaysia will be using HIV drugs as treatment for coronavirus as being done in China, Dr Dzulkefly said: “The effectiveness of the drugs needs to be verified first.”-- BERNAMA
news_content_translate_cn: 普特拉贾亚，1月28日——卫生部长达图克塞里博士说，截至今天中午，又有3例疑似2019年新型冠状病毒（2019 nCoV）的新病例等待实验室检测结果。他说，这3例病例均涉及中国公民，在过去24小时内，他接受了由旅游部长主持的讨论冠状病毒爆发问题的特别会议后对记者说：“三名被调查者中，有两名在兰卡威，一名在宾图鲁。这三名被调查者都是中国公民。”，今天在这里的艺术和文化达图·穆罕默德·克塔皮博士说，上星期一报告的另外五个病例的实验室检测结果是阴性的，其中两个在兰卡威，两个在吉隆坡，一个在宾图鲁。马来西亚2019例nCoV阳性病例目前仍为四个，全部涉及中国他说，马来西亚的冠状病毒病例是通过两种方法确定的，一种是与2019年nCoV阳性的人密切接触，另一种是出现疑似冠状病毒感染的症状，并成为一种PUI。他说，在4例阳性病例中，有3例是通过密切接触确定的，另一个是禽流感病例。到目前为止，他说马来西亚有65个禽流感病毒感染者，其中34个是马来西亚公民，30个是中国公民，1个是约旦人。65个禽流感病毒感染者中的一个在2019年nCoV检测呈阳性，3个仍在等待实验室检测结果，另外61个检测呈阴性。当被问及马来西亚是否会使用艾滋病药物时作为在中国正在进行的冠状病毒治疗，朱尔凯夫博士说：“药物的有效性需要首先得到验证。”

news_content_translate_en:
Franka Lu is a Chinese journalist and entrepreneur. She works in China and Germany. In this TIME ONLINE series she critically reports on life, culture and everyday life in China. To protect her professional and private environment, she writes under a pseudonym.
At the apparent peak of his power, the most powerful authoritarian regime in the world is shaken by a virus. This country, the People's Republic of China under Xi Jinping, is about to become a world leader in the development of quantum computers and artificial intelligence, it has excellent telecommunications technology, the fastest trains in the world, highly trained officials and a prestigious viral research. But all this is of little concern to the new Coronavirus.
Its spread now exposes the weaknesses of the system mercilessly. China's bureaucratic health system was clearly not prepared for such a case. Overcrowded hospitals rejected patients, initially poorly protected doctors and carers even contracted the Coronavirus. And the question is long overdue, with the Chinese central government actually being more efficient in recent weeks: in controlling the outbreak of disease, or rather in controlling the population and the flow of information?
In times of social media, especially in China, where WeChat and Weibo are the big platforms instead of Facebook and Twitter, it is now clear that information shared by users on social media can only be controlled by means of censorship and thus deletion only conditionally. These users come especially from the younger generation, in the 1980s or after, whose members have never experienced such chaos
Yeah. These youngsters have grown up in the most economically happy decades of Chinese history and have benefited from the growing prosperity that their parents, in particular, have achieved and that is largely due to the globalisation from which China has benefited so unprecedented as a place of production. These young Chinese people have so far largely trusted the communist authorities. Their lack of response to the threat posed by the new Coronavirus now shakes this belief.
In the crisis, young people mobilise an unprecedented energy to help themselves, and they also often organise it through social media. They provide respiratory masks and bring them to hospitals; they provide medical personnel with cars; they help elderly and sick people trapped at home and try to support refugees from Hubei. Civilian society is making great efforts to fill the gap that leaves a lack of action on the part of the authorities and their obvious over-reliance on the outbreak of the virus.
At the same time, the existence of social media platforms allows something quite different: it is precisely thanks to them that an attempt can be made to reconstruct the events since the emergence of the new Coronavirus in China, as they have largely not been reported in the state media; also a report by Human Rights Watch, the 30th. In January, it supports these searches. These show how inadequate or even covert the authorities have acted at local and central level until at least mid-January.
The story of the spread of this virus began almost a month and a half ago as many disasters in China, as rumor
Yeah. When patients with identical symptoms arrived in a hospital at the end of December in the 14-million-city of Wuhan, doctors reported the cases to the local centre for disease care, a half-body. According to social media posts, their officials appeared on 27. In December "very impatient" in the hospital there and listened to the concerns of the doctors with great reluctance.
Three days later, 30th. In December 2019, this precautionary authority communicated internally that all hospitals should be prepared for an "unknown lung disease", with doctors being "strictly forbidden" to give information to the public. Nor did the Authority itself inform the public. Doctors who did not work directly in the departments for fever and lung diseases were left in the dark about the possible seriousness of the situation and were therefore unprotected in dealing with possible Corona patients. Many of them later experienced how serious the situation really was.
In the afternoon and evening of this day, several doctors from different hospitals posted in their chat groups and WeChat diagnoses of their patients and expressed their concern about the inactivity of the precautionary authority. They warned colleagues of the dangers posed by the local fish and game market, which was soon suspected of being an outbreak. Doctors also explained that the symptoms of the expanding lung disease were reminiscent of Sars, the highly contagious, life-threatening infectious disease that had spread from South China at the end of 2002, early 2003. This information and internal government communication reached the public, screenshots from the chats spread virally. On Weibo, users started using the hashtag WuhanSARS. Their posts were quickly deleted from censorship.
On the morning of 31
Yeah. In December, one of the doctors who published the information on the new Coronavirus was appointed by the City Health Commission of Wuhan, the city's top health authority, WMHC. He had to reveal his sources. The next day, the party secretary's office asked the doctor for an apology for the "spread of rumors" and also for an assurance that from now on nothing would leak out. Then he had to take a warning from the police and sign it.
On the same day, for the first time, official media representatives came to the WMHC to obtain confirmation of the "rumours" that had been circulating for several days. Under increasing pressure, the WMHC was forced to make a public statement; the number of 27 cases of corona infection was officially confirmed. Afterwards, the top Chinese health authority, the NHC in Beijing, sent a group of experts to Wuhan. At the latest there had been reports of a possible mass-spreading disease in the Chinese capital.
In the meantime, the Wuhan fish and wildlife market continued to dominate. A journalist interviewed the dealers, where no one had heard of the virus. Wild animals were sold further. Only after this report appeared on the government's First Finance news page from Shanghai did the market become the first. January 2020 closed.
At that time there were already eight people who were investigated by the police for "spreading rumors" about the virus disease. News spokesmen announced the arrests on local and central government channels such as China Central TV with a stern face: "The Internet is not a free space!" No word was lost on what rumors the alleged culprits had spread.
I have 11. Finally, in January, the physician initially admitted to hospital
Yeah. Diagnosis: pneumonia. The Coronavirus? Even more than two weeks later, the physician was still severely affected, he was not told about the medical findings on his own body. Many infected patients have suffered the same fate. Of the people who had already confirmed more than 200 to the consequences of the Coronavirus in China, at least initially, many apparently did not know what they were suffering from at all.
The Chinese government has long obstructed the search for the truth with ever-new blurring tactics. Officials threw out to the public only little information, dubious statistics, mixed with increasingly angry statements of determination to win the "war against the plague".
A case of obvious cover-up is, for example, the fact that the city government of Wuhan of the 3rd. up to 15. In January, no new cases of infection reported as if the virus had been stopped by magic. Experienced observers were able to see through the spell: it happened to be precisely the days during which the People's Congress of Hubei Province was held in the city (Wuhan is the capital of Hubei). It was the same game as at the beginning of the Sars crisis in 2002/2003: at the time, however, the Beijing government had steadfastly denied the epidemic for months, in order to "stability" around the Peking National Congress in the spring. 17-years have passed since then without really passing.
An article from the specialist magazine The Lancet was published on 24th. January retroactive that on the 2nd. In January 41 hospital patients and patients in Wuhan submitted laboratory-based infections with the virus now called 2019-nCoV
Yeah. Five days before this publication, Wuhan's head of health care, Wang Guangfa, had told journalists that the new Coronavirus was "not very contagious", that the risk of transmission from person to person was "low". The disease can be "prevented and controlled". Where Wang Guangfa got his information and whether he himself did not already know better cannot be said. In any case, two days after the press conference, he himself became ill from this not very contagious disease.
And People's Daily reported online that the cause of the diseases is not yet established, whether it is Sars or, more likely, a less dangerous disease. But even if it's saris, we have a sophisticated system of prevention and control. The people of Wuhan have no reason to panic."
The inhabitants of the city were calm and continued their holiday preparations. In the coming weeks, five million of them flocked to spend the end of January's New Year's Eve with their families. Thousands traveled abroad. Meanwhile, social media posts have been appearing in which people have reported strange diseases to their relatives or acquaintances in Beijing, Changsha, Shenzhen, Wenzhou, and soon to Japan and Thailand. The Chinese media froze. No one dared investigate these new cases. There was a loose tone in the state media, and the short reports on the disease highlighted the competence of the government and spread optimism.
Only in Hong Kong was the situation taken very seriously very early on. I got four. In January, seven suspected cases of the disease were reported. The government there immediately took strict precautions, with great transparency in information policy
Yeah. The relatively independent press played an important role in this. The television stations reported around the clock. Journalists and journalists were sent to the mainland of China to investigate, but some of them were immediately thrown out or questioned by the police.
Already at seven. In January, Starry Lee, chairman of the Beijing-loyal Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong, then travelled to the Chinese capital and asked the central government to improve the flow of information around the epidemic. Among the relevant reports in online media, government trolls and patriots then came to them: "Then you cannot demonstrate! You Hong Kong people are polluting the environment!"
When there was scarcely anything left to hide and embellish, the governments of Hubei Province and Wuhan continued to hold all kinds of galas and events for the celebration of the Chinese New Year's Eve. Still on 18th. In January, the city organized a feast for 40.000 families who cooked and ate together. The participants clearly believed the official slogans: trust the government! No one seemed aware of the situation that the Coronavirus could also celebrate a feast here.
I got 19. In January, the state media suddenly announced with great Tamtam the return of a now 84-year-old hero from the fight against Sars in the 2003 year: Out of the blue Zhong Nanshan, lung specialist and former president of the Chinese Medical Association, was called to a medical-propaganda battle. He managed to squeeze himself into the dining cars of a fast-track in the south of Guangzhou. In Wuhan he was written and immediately continued to Beijing the next day to report to the health authority. Am 20
Yeah. In January, he confessed to journalists that the transmission of the virus from person to person was possible and at that time 14 representatives of the medical staff were already infected. After this brilliant interview, he went underground.
Only now did the media decide to ignore the government's seemingly existing muzzle. Brave journalists and journalists of the few remaining traditional media travelled to Wuhan to investigate on the spot. Many online rumors were confirmed: hospitals were actually overloaded and had to reject numerous patients, doctors and nurses were sick, officials had lied and concealed, there were apparently not enough test kits to test all patients for the virus.
The official news had said that hospitals had been supplied with at least 100.000 of these test kits, and patients were provided with 4.000 beds, while the number of confirmed infections and suspected cases were still in triplicate.
Yeah. But where were those test kits and the hospital beds? And where was the "sufficient quantity" of masks, gloves and protective clothing? How could the pleading calls from reputable hospitals from all over China for all this be explained?
What about the heartbreaking appeals of children in social media who are desperate for treatment for their parents, grandparents and themselves? Who are the people in the online videos who just roll over on the street at the top of the hospital queuing up? What about the young woman who, in vain, tries to get one office after another to accept her grandmother's body at home? What about the doctor who breaks down and yells, "Get rid of those lying in the hallway! Immediately!" With the social-media viral video of the nurse crying hysterically during her lunch break?
For other things, the government agencies apparently had time and money: the best telecommunication technology in the world is said to have been used to monitor all mobile users in the province of Hubei and to report to other provinces the number of visitors from the endangered region. Some local authorities also reported their names, addresses and ID numbers. Travelers from Hubei were rejected in hotels. Some were misled on the open road, insulted or even beaten, it is reported. The local authorities prepared accommodation for the unwelcome refugees, but then failed to tell people where to find the accommodation.
People have recognized the logic (or illogical) of the "fight against the virus" by now: In hospitals, even the admitted patients have apparently tested only part of the virus
Yeah. The relatively small number of confirmed infections (now officially over 17.000 people in China) that initially appeared to be relatively small due to the huge containment measures, for example in Wuhan, can be explained at least in part by this and also by that apparently just a lot of patients were rejected and not treated at all. The data and statistics transmitted from China to the Coronavirus should in any case only be believed with reservation.
In the Chinese network, the sick and their relatives, when they speak on social media, are now being harassed by trolls. They accuse patients of being simulators or enemy agents, demand proof of their plight and then discredit that evidence. An example is the case of a young woman who, like her father and grandmother, was infected and rejected by a hospital. She asked for help from a woman. Thousands of hate comments gathered under their mail. She begged and she was furious, and then all that was left on her account was the word "deceased." The government maintains a zombie army of paid hate commentators. Not all trolls are part of it, but their culture feeds their hatred.
The leader of the nation and creator of the "Dream of China", Chairman Xi Jinping, has so far not visited Wuhan or any of the hospitals in the country where people suffering from the Coronavirus are treated. Instead, he gave a vague and prominent speech, signalling the will to fight, but also emphasising his government's "stability and great vision". Even the one on 27. In January, a late-deployed "epidemic prevention team" was not in front of Xi, but Prime Minister Li Keqiang. It was only after a meeting with the Director-General of the World Health Organisation that Xi took the lead.
For many Chinese, this is a time of "Truth Overdemand"
Yeah. It is impossible to list all that they have had to experience in recent weeks. But one thing is certain: the image of the Chinese Government as an embodiment of efficiency, unlimited resources and unquestionable authority, on which the government itself has been working for decades, is badly damaged. Meanwhile, some fear a total collapse of the Chinese economy due to the epidemic. However strong the resilience of the Chinese leadership may be, it is the first time in a long time that it has shown cracks. These could get bigger. For the basic capital of the government, however unfaithful it may have been acquired, is in danger: faced with the threat of a virus, many people now realize that propaganda is not a medical cure.
German by Jakob Klagen
