陆克文是一位中国记者和企业家。她在中国和德国工作。在这个时间在线系列中，她批判性地报道了中国的生活、文化和日常生活。为了保护自己的职业和私人环境，她用笔名写作。
在他权力的巅峰时期，世界上最强大的独裁政权受到病毒的冲击。这个国家，即习近平领导下的中华人民共和国，即将成为量子计算机和人工智能发展的世界领头羊，拥有卓越的电信技术、世界上最快的火车、训练有素的官员和久负盛名的病毒研究。但所有这些都与新型冠状病毒无关。
它的传播现在无情地暴露了这个系统的弱点。中国的官僚医疗体系显然没有准备好应对这种情况。过度拥挤的医院拒绝接受病人，最初保护不力的医生和护理人员甚至感染了冠状病毒。而这个问题早就应该提出来了，中国中央政府最近几周实际上更有效率：控制疾病的爆发，还是控制人口和信息的流动？
在社交媒体时代，尤其是在中国，微信和微博是社交媒体的大平台，而不是Facebook和Twitter，现在很明显，用户在社交媒体上共享的信息只能通过审查来控制，因此只能有条件地删除。这些用户尤其来自20世纪80年代或之后的年轻一代，他们的成员从未经历过这样的混乱
是 啊。这些年轻人是在中国历史上经济最幸福的几十年中成长起来的，他们尤其受益于父母所取得的日益增长的繁荣，这主要是由于全球化，中国作为一个生产地从中获得了前所未有的利益。这些中国年轻人到目前为止基本上信任共产党当局。他们对新冠状病毒构成的威胁缺乏反应，现在动摇了这种信念。
在这场危机中，年轻人调动了前所未有的能量来帮助自己，他们也经常通过社交媒体组织起来。他们提供呼吸面罩并将其送往医院；他们为医务人员提供汽车；他们帮助被困在家中的老人和病人，并设法支持来自湖北的难民。民间社会正在作出巨大努力，以填补这一空白，即当局缺乏行动，显然过度依赖病毒的爆发。
同时，社交媒体平台的存在也带来了一些截然不同的东西：正是由于这些平台，才有可能试图重建自中国出现新型冠状病毒以来发生的事件，因为这些事件基本上没有在官方媒体上报道过；还有人权观察的一份报告，30号。一月份，它支持这些搜索。这些都表明，至少在1月中旬之前，当局在地方和中央层面的行动是多么不充分，甚至是多么隐蔽。
这种病毒的传播故事开始于一个半月前，与传言中的中国灾难一样多
是 啊。去年12月底，在武汉1400万城市，当症状相同的患者到达医院时，医生将这些病例报告给当地的疾病护理中心，这是一个半身。根据社交媒体的帖子，他们的官员27日出现。去年12月在那里的医院里“非常不耐烦”，极不情愿地听取了医生们的担忧。
三天后，30号。2019年12月，这个预防机构内部沟通，所有医院都应做好“不明肺病”的准备，医生“严禁”向公众提供信息。当局本身也没有通知公众。没有直接在发热和肺部疾病科室工作的医生对情况可能的严重性一无所知，因此在处理可能的科罗娜患者时没有受到保护。他们中的许多人后来经历了情况的严重性。
当天下午和晚上，几位来自不同医院的医生在聊天组和微信上发布了对患者的诊断，并对防范机构的不作为表示了关注。他们警告同事，当地的鱼和猎物市场构成了危险，很快就被怀疑是疫情爆发。医生们还解释说，肺部疾病不断扩大的症状让人想起了Sars，这是一种传染性很强、威胁生命的传染病，2002年底、2003年初从华南地区蔓延开来。这一信息和政府内部的沟通传到了公众手中，截图从聊天中病毒般传播开来。在微博上，用户开始使用whansars这个标签。他们的帖子很快就从审查中删除了。
31日上午
是 啊。去年12月，武汉市卫生委员会（武汉市最高卫生行政部门）任命了一名发布新型冠状病毒信息的医生。他不得不透露他的消息来源。第二天，党委书记办公室要求医生为“谣言的传播”道歉，并保证从今以后不会泄露任何信息。然后他不得不接受警察的警告并签字。
同一天，官方媒体代表首次来到世卫组织，对流传数天的“谣言”进行确认。迫于越来越大的压力，WMHC被迫发表公开声明；27例corona感染病例得到官方证实。之后，中国最高卫生当局，北京的国家卫生委员会，派出了一个专家组到武汉。最近有报道称，中国首都可能出现大规模传播疾病。
与此同时，武汉鱼类和野生动物市场继续占据主导地位。一名记者采访了那些没有听说过这种病毒的经销商。野生动物被进一步出售。直到这篇报道出现在上海政府的第一个财经新闻页面上，市场才成为第一个。2020年1月关闭。
当时已经有8人因“散布谣言”而被警方调查。新闻发言人在中央电视台等地方和中央政府频道以严厉的口吻宣布逮捕行动：“互联网不是一个自由的空间！”没有人透露被指控的罪犯散布了什么谣言。
我有11个。最后，在一月份，医生最初住进了医院
是 啊。诊断：肺炎。冠状病毒？甚至两个多星期后，医生仍然受到严重影响，他没有被告知自己身上的医学发现。许多受感染的病人也遭遇了同样的命运。至少在最初，已经证实中国有200多人感染了冠状病毒，其中许多人显然根本不知道自己的病情。
长期以来，中国政府一直以新的模糊策略阻碍着对真相的探索。官员们只向公众公布了很少的信息和可疑的统计数字，其中还夹杂着对赢得“抗击瘟疫战争”决心的越来越愤怒的声明。
一个明显掩盖的例子是，例如，武汉市政府3号。最多15个。一月份，没有新的感染病例报告，就好像病毒被魔法阻止了一样。有经验的观察家能够看穿这个咒语：恰好是湖北省人大在武汉召开的日子。这与2002/2003年非典危机爆发之初的博弈如出一辙：然而，当时北京政府几个月来一直坚决否认这一流行病，以期在春季北京全国代表大会前后“稳定”。17年过去了，没有真正的过去。
专业杂志《柳叶刀》24日发表了一篇文章。一月二日追溯。今年1月，武汉市41名医院患者和患者提交了基于实验室的病毒感染报告，现在称为2019 nCoV
是 啊。在这篇文章发表前五天，武汉市卫生局局长王广发曾告诉记者，这种新型冠状病毒“传染性不强”，人与人之间传播的风险“很低”。这种疾病可以“预防和控制”。王广发是从哪里得到消息的，他自己是否还不清楚，不能说。无论如何，在记者招待会后的两天，他自己也因为这种传染性不大的疾病而生病。
而《人民日报》则在网上报道说，这些疾病的病因尚未确定，无论是非典还是更可能是一种危险性较小的疾病。但即使是saris，我们也有一套复杂的预防和控制系统。武汉人没有理由恐慌。”
城里的居民很平静，继续他们的假期准备工作。在接下来的几周里，他们中的五百万人成群结队地和家人一起度过一月份的除夕夜。成千上万的人出国旅行。与此同时，社交媒体的帖子也不断出现，人们向北京、长沙、深圳、温州的亲戚或熟人报告了奇怪的疾病，并很快向日本和泰国报告。中国媒体停滞不前。没有人敢调查这些新案件。官方媒体语调松散，有关该病的简短报道突出了政府的能力，传播了乐观情绪。
只有在香港，情况才很早就被认真对待。我有四个。1月份，报告了7例疑似病例。那里的政府立即采取了严格的预防措施，信息政策非常透明
是 啊。相对独立的媒体在这方面发挥了重要作用。电视台昼夜不停地报道。记者和记者被派往中国大陆调查，但其中一些立即被警察赶出去或询问。
已经七点了。今年1月，北京忠诚民主促进香港改善进步联盟主席李星斗随后前往中国首都，要求中央政府改善疫情信息流通。在网络媒体的相关报道中，政府巨魔和爱国者随后来到他们面前：“那你就不能示威了！你们香港人在污染环境！”
湖北省和武汉市政府在没有什么可隐瞒和美化的时候，继续举办各种庆祝除夕的晚会和活动，直到18日。今年1月，该市组织了4万户家庭一起做饭、吃饭的盛宴。与会者显然相信官方的口号：相信政府！似乎没有人意识到冠状病毒也可以在这里庆祝盛宴。
我得了19分。今年1月，官方媒体突然与大谭一起宣布，一位现年84岁的英雄在2003年抗击非典的战斗中复出：出人意料的是，肺科专家、中华医学会原会长钟南山被召去参加一场医学宣传战。他设法挤进了广州南部一条快车道的餐车里。在武汉，他被写下，并立即在第二天继续到北京向卫生局报告。上午20点
是 啊。今年1月，他向记者坦言，病毒有可能在人与人之间传播，当时已有14名医务人员代表受到感染。在这次出色的面试之后，他转入了地下。
直到现在，媒体才决定忽略政府似乎存在的枪口。剩下的少数传统媒体的勇敢记者和记者前往武汉实地调查。许多网络谣言得到证实：医院实际上超载，不得不拒绝众多病人，医生和护士生病，官员撒谎和隐瞒，显然没有足够的测试包来测试所有病人的病毒。
官方消息称，医院至少提供了10万个这样的测试包，病人有4000张床位，而确诊感染和疑似病例的数量仍有三倍。
是 啊。但是那些测试包和病床呢？面具、手套和防护服的“足够数量”在哪里？如何解释来自中国各地知名医院的求情电话？
那些在社交媒体上渴望得到父母、祖父母和自己治疗的孩子们的心碎呼吁呢？在网上视频中，在医院最前面的街道上翻滚排队的人是谁？那个白费力气，一个接一个地想在家里接受祖母遗体的年轻女人呢？那医生怎么办？他崩溃了，喊道：“把那些躺在走廊里的人赶走！立即！”在社交媒体上疯传护士午休时歇斯底里哭泣的视频？
另一方面，政府机构显然有时间和金钱：据说世界上最好的电信技术已被用于监测湖北省的所有移动用户，并向其他省份报告来自濒危地区的游客数量。一些地方当局还报告了他们的姓名、地址和身份证号码。来自湖北的旅客在旅馆被拒绝。据报道，一些人在公路上被误导，受到侮辱甚至殴打。当地政府为那些不受欢迎的难民准备了住处，但后来没有告诉人们哪里可以找到住处。
到目前为止，人们已经认识到“与病毒作斗争”的逻辑（或不合逻辑）：在医院里，即使住院的病人显然也只检测了部分病毒
是 啊。最初由于巨大的遏制措施（例如在武汉）而显得相对较少的确诊感染人数（目前在中国正式超过17000人）至少可以部分地解释这一点，也可以解释为很明显，很多病人被拒绝接受治疗。从中国传给冠状病毒的数据和统计数据无论如何都只能被保留地相信。
在中国网络中，病人和他们的亲属在社交媒体上发言时，现在正受到巨魔的骚扰。他们指责病人是模拟器或敌方特工，要求证明他们的困境，然后诋毁证据。一个例子是一个年轻的妇女，像她的父亲和祖母一样，被医院感染和拒绝。她向一个女人求助。成千上万的仇恨评论聚集在他们的邮件下。她乞求着，怒不可遏，然后她只剩下了一个词“死亡”政府维持着一支由付费仇恨评论员组成的僵尸军队。并非所有的巨魔都是其中的一部分，但他们的文化助长了他们的仇恨。
国家领导人、“中国梦”的缔造者、国家主席习近平到目前为止还没有去过武汉，也没有去过全国治疗冠状病毒感染者的医院。相反，他发表了一个模糊而突出的讲话，表明了战斗的意愿，但也强调了他的政府的“稳定和伟大的愿景”。即使是27号的那个。今年1月，一支部署较晚的“防疫队”并没有出现在习近平面前，而是总理李克强。习近平是在与世界卫生组织总干事会晤后才率先采取行动的。
对许多中国人来说，这是一个“真理要求过高”的时代
是 啊。不可能列出他们最近几周所经历的一切。但有一点是肯定的：中国政府作为效率、无限资源和毋庸置疑的权威的化身的形象，政府本身几十年来一直致力于此，现在已经严重受损。与此同时，一些人担心中国经济会因为这种流行病而彻底崩溃。不管中国领导层的弹性有多强，这是很长时间以来第一次出现裂痕。这些可能会变大。因为政府的基本资本，不管它有多么不忠，都处于危险之中：面对病毒的威胁，许多人现在意识到，宣传不是一种医疗方法。
德文作者：Jakob Klagen

news_title_translate_en: Three more Coronavirus cases confirmed in Bavaria
news_title_translate_cn: 巴伐利亚州又确诊三例冠状病毒病例
news_content_translate_en:
The new Coronavirus from China has now also arrived in Germany. The Bavarian health authorities confirmed the first four cases in the Federal Republic on Tuesday.
At first the new lung disease had been detected in a 33-year-old man from Landsberg am Lech district. He was infected in his company in a suburb of Munich with a colleague from China. On Tuesday evening, the Bavarian Ministry of Health announced that three more people were infected with the new Coronavirus. "These patients are also employees of Starnberg County," he continued.
The four persons concerned were admitted stationary at the Munich clinic Schwabing, where they were medically monitored and isolated, as the Ministry reported. "Some other contact persons are currently being tested for an infection with the Coronavirus as well." Bayern's Minister of Health Melanie Huml (CSU) said, "The company's total number of 40 employees who are eligible as close contacts has been identified. The people concerned should be tested on Wednesday as a precautionary measure."Then the Ministry also wants to inform the press about the current situation.
According to information from the Bavarian National Office for Health and Food Safety (LGL), the 33-year-old had contracted an infection with a colleague from China who had received training last week on the Webasto car supplier in the Gautinger district of Stockdorf in the Upper Bavarian district of Starnberg. The woman didn't have her infection until 23rd. January on the return flight to China.
The new Coronavirus 2019-nCoV can cause a lung disease in which more than 100 people have already died in the main country of China, most of which were elderly patients with severe pre-existing diseases.
Yeah. The total number of known diseases worldwide has now increased to more than 4500, with at least 106 people dying of lung disease in China.
The first Coronavirus patient had tested positive for the virus on Monday and had gone back to work. "He is quite well, he was still working yesterday morning," LGL President Andreas Zapf said. "He is fever-free and has no respiratory symptoms at the moment," added Chief Medical Officer Clemens Wendtner of Schwabing Clinic. The man is in an isolation room, there was no danger to other patients.
According to LGL data, the people who had contact with the Chinese and the first sick German Webasto employee are under observation and are urged not to leave their home. According to the Ministry of Health, his child goes to a crib in Landsberg am Lech district. This too is now under observation, LGL President Zapf said. The family status of the three other patients was not known at first. The head of the Infectiology Task Force, Martin Hoch, stressed: "The number can still rise."
The new virus 2019-nCoV was originally believed to originate from a market in the Chinese millionaire city of Wuhan, where wild animals traded there probably jumped to humans. According to current experts, the new type of lung disease appears to be mild in most cases, possibly even without symptoms.
Transmission before the first symptoms are considered very rare. Thus, the first confirmed case of Coronavirus in Germany may also provide new insights into the pathways of infection of lung disease. Because the man was infected with the Chinese woman after initial knowledge, although at the time she showed no symptoms of the disease.
The authorities now want to gradually introduce further measures in Bavaria
Yeah. An official hotline of the Bavarian authorities was established, and some health insurance companies did so. Passengers at Munich Airport are required to see a doctor if they suspect an infection with the new Coronavirus, according to the information provided by the National Office with posters in three languages. Further escalation stages of the alert plan are possible: Currently, together with the federation, it is being discussed "whether it might be useful to measure fever at airports," said Minister Huml. In view of the Coronavirus outbreak this year, the world's largest toy fair in Nuremberg is expecting fewer visitors from China.
There is no reason to panic, said Huml, as well as her colleague, Federal Health Minister Jens Spahn (CDU). The case shows "that we are well prepared," he said. The risk to human health in Germany remains low, according to the Robert Koch Institute.
Despite this, respiratory masks were sold out in individual pharmacies in Bavaria. He has heard this from companies in Lower Franconia and Munich, a spokesman for the Bavarian Pharmaceutical Association of the German Press Agency said.
The management of Webasto has cleared the staff at Stockdorfer Central for this week whether they want to come to the office or rather work at home. Webasto is a major supplier for the automotive industry with 13,400 employees and a turnover of 3,4 billion euro. The company had previously cancelled all business trips to China for the next two weeks. BMW, Audi and Siemens also stated that only strictly necessary business trips to China will take place. (dpa)
news_content_translate_cn:
来自中国的新型冠状病毒目前也已抵达德国。巴伐利亚州卫生当局周二证实了联邦共和国的前四例病例。
起初，在兰兹贝格-阿姆-莱赫区的一名33岁男子身上发现了新的肺病。他与一位来自中国的同事在慕尼黑郊区的公司感染了病毒。星期二晚上，巴伐利亚州卫生部宣布又有三人感染了这种新型冠状病毒。“这些病人也是斯坦伯格县的雇员，”他继续说。
据德国卫生部报道，这4名涉案人员在慕尼黑施瓦宾诊所（Munich clinic Schwabing）被收治时是静止不动的，他们在那里接受了医学监测和隔离。拜仁卫生部长梅兰妮·休姆（Melanie Huml）说：“目前，其他一些接触者也在接受冠状病毒感染检测，拜仁共有40名员工符合密切接触的条件。作为预防措施，有关人员应该在周三接受检测。”然后，卫生部还想向新闻界通报目前的情况。
根据来自巴伐利亚州国家卫生和食品安全办公室（LGL）的信息，这位33岁的年轻人与一位中国同事感染了病毒，他上周在斯塔恩伯格上巴伐利亚州斯托克多夫的高廷格区接受了Webasto汽车供应商的培训。这名妇女直到23日才感染。一月份返回中国的航班。
2019年新型冠状病毒nCoV可导致中国主要国家已有100多人死亡的肺病，其中大部分是患有严重既往疾病的老年患者。
是 啊。目前，全球已知疾病总数已增至4500多种，中国至少有106人死于肺病。
第一个冠状病毒病人在星期一检测出病毒阳性，现在已经回去工作了。LGL总裁扎普夫（Andreas Zapf）说：“他很好，昨天早上还在工作。”。施瓦宾诊所的首席医疗官克莱门斯·温特纳补充说：“他目前没有发烧，也没有呼吸系统症状。”。这个人在隔离室里，对其他病人没有危险。
根据LGL的数据，与中国人和第一个生病的德国Webasto员工有过接触的人正在接受观察，并被敦促不要离开他们的家。根据卫生部的说法，他的孩子去了兰茨贝格阿姆莱赫区的一个婴儿床。LGL总裁扎普夫说，这也在观察之中。其他三名患者的家庭状况一开始并不清楚。传染病专责小组的负责人马丁霍克强调说：“这个数字还会上升。”
2019年新病毒nCoV最初被认为来自中国百万富翁城市武汉的一个市场，那里交易的野生动物可能跳到了人类身上。据目前的专家称，这种新型肺病在大多数情况下似乎是轻微的，甚至可能没有症状。
在第一症状出现之前传播被认为是非常罕见的。因此，德国首例冠状病毒确诊病例也可能为肺部疾病的感染途径提供新的见解。因为这名男子是在初步了解中国女子感染后，虽然当时她没有出现疾病症状。
当局现在希望在巴伐利亚逐步采取进一步措施
是 啊。巴伐利亚当局开通了官方热线，一些健康保险公司也开通了热线。根据国家办公室提供的信息，慕尼黑机场的乘客如果怀疑感染了新的冠状病毒，必须去看医生。预警计划的进一步升级阶段是可能的：目前，正在与联邦一起讨论“在机场测量发烧是否有用”，休姆部长说。鉴于今年冠状病毒的爆发，纽伦堡世界最大的玩具展预计来自中国的游客将减少。
休姆和她的同事、联邦卫生部长延斯•斯潘（Jens Spahn）说，没有理由恐慌。他说，这起案件表明“我们准备充分”。据罗伯特·科赫研究所称，德国的人类健康风险仍然很低。
尽管如此，巴伐利亚州的个别药店的呼吸面罩还是卖光了。德国新闻机构巴伐利亚制药协会的发言人说，他已经从下弗朗索尼亚和慕尼黑的公司那里听到了这一消息。
本周，Webasto的管理层已经让Stockdorfer Central的员工清楚了，他们是来办公室还是在家工作。伟巴斯特是汽车行业的主要供应商，拥有13400名员工和34亿欧元的营业额。此前，该公司已取消了未来两周所有赴中国的商务旅行。宝马、奥迪和西门子也表示，只会进行严格必要的中国商务旅行。（dpa）

news_title_translate_en: The colours of the resistance in Hong Kong
news_title_translate_cn: 香港抗战的色彩
news_content_translate_en:
From afar, it may look like everything is back to normal. "But nothing is normal anymore," he says. Not at all. The protests in Hong Kong, with pictures of burning barricades and beating up police officers around the world in the last six months, have become quieter and rarer. They're not gone, they just moved. Kelvin better not mention his real name. It's late January, the last night of the Chinese New Year's Eve, the 22-year-old is on his way to visit relatives.
The telephone connection is scratchy, "I'm on the subway," says Kelvin bluntly as if through cotton wool. He's wearing a mask again. But not a heavy one, against tear gas fog, but a light one, against the Coronavirus, which found its way to Hong Kong. The day before, the head of government, Carrie Lam, declared a state of emergency. The local Disneyland closes, photos show public places empty and abandoned, demonstrations will not take place for the time being. However, companies threaten to strike doctors and nurses for Monday, if the government does not agree to seal Hong Kong off completely for visitors from mainland China.
End of New Year holidays
In fact, after the end of the New Year's holidays, the students of the city should have returned to school on Monday. On Friday, however, Lam announced that the schools would remain closed due to the risk of infection until March. "The city is in panic," says Kelvin. Nothing is normal anymore. But that's not what he wants right now.
2020 everything will be different, Hong Kong Managing Director Matthew Cheung had promised in December. Kelvin laughs bitterly. He hasn't had faith in politics in a long time. Kelvin says he went to the last demonstration about once a week. And of course there are always violent scenes, the police continue to act violently
Yeah. But the real protest no longer takes place on the streets, but on the economic level. In recent months, something that demonstrators have called yellow economy has developed, yellow economy.
In an ever-growing kind of online registry, shops, restaurants, even fitness studios are referred to as either yellow or blue. Yellow means democracy-friendly. Blue: Beijing friendly. "I'm strict," says Kelvin, "I don't spend a penny on those who face the protests in cold blood." It is the collateral damage of a revolution that ordinary employees can also be affected, whose contracts are terminated. That's what they say happened.
Important financial and commercial space
There's no way to verify that in detail. But it seems clear that Hong Kong's economy, which is an important financial and trading place for China, has suffered under the protests. Governor Carrie Lam is constantly warning of bad numbers. But if this should frighten the demonstrators, it will not work. If economic pressure on the Beijing Government does not work, what then? Kelvin says, "How you spend your money is like voting in an election." At the same time, it is a low-threshold form of protest. Anyone can participate without putting themselves in danger. Consumption has long become political. It fits with this protest movement that the next dynamic strategy developed from the depths of its creative mass.
"Be Water, My Friend", a six-month quote by Bruce Lee had been the motto of the Hong Kong demonstrators. At the beginning of June 2019, hundreds of thousands had taken to the streets for the first time to protest against a change in the law that would allow the extradition of suspects and criminals to China without difficulty
Yeah. Kelvin was there for the first time as a Hong Kong policeman, who was massively against demonstrators, on the 12th. June! It was an earlier turning point after which the first peaceful protest changed radically. Both sides were equipped: the police with even more tear gas, rubber bullets, water jets and clubs; the mostly young demonstrators with Molotov cocktails and professional equipment. Streets became battlefields, weekly.
Hard judgments
Kelvin works at a law firm during the week. As an assistant, he handles cases of young demonstrators to be convicted of possession of weapons. For hours, he watches CCTV footage to be able to tell exactly what happened when, as in an altercation with the police. He says he's happy to be able to do this job, even if it's not always fair. Because some judges speeded up proceedings in order to quickly condemn people; because many, in doubt, always opted for the harsher verdict. "Last week," he says, "a 23-year-old girl was sentenced to twelve months in prison for helping a demonstrator wear Molotov cocktails."
Reuters News Agency recently wrote about 7000-year-old people who were arrested during the seven-month protests. According to police chief Chris Tang, 1092 had been convicted. Most of the nine. June to 14th. November 2019 prisoners were reported to be between 21 and 25 years old, most of them male. Half a year of protests have divided the city into supporters and opponents of Beijing, but have also torn families apart. The conflict is also one between generations, the youth thinking yellow, the grandparents blue.
Fear of persecution
This is the case, for example, with 23-year-old Dawn. Nor does she mention her real name out of fear of persecution
Yeah. For months, it has been avoiding confrontation with relatives loyal to the Chinese state. Like your over-80-year-old grandfather. Only relatives from the mainland managed to convince him of his travel plans for the New Year's Eve. Until then, he believed the Communist Party had control of the Coronavirus outbreak. She also visited her family for New Year's. Because the relatives ordered the food from a blue restaurant, they also ordered it from a yellow restaurant. The disgust remained because, exceptionally, everyone talked about the Coronavirus and not about politics. She regularly sends parents lists of "permitted" shops. Sometimes, she says, they stuck to it. For her, as for Kelvin, that's not a question. "I got used to looking before entering a store." She says, laughing at the snakes at the door, even without an app.
By Whatsapp, Dawn sends links to the apps she uses. The city maps are covered with yellow, blue and some red dots. Attention: mainland Chinese capital! A McDonald's in the Pok Fu Lam district is marked blue, a window with explanations opens after a click. Including those on 25th. In August 2019 vouchers were issued to police officers. Meat Pie Gor restaurant in Tai Wai is yellow. The owners have sided with the demonstrators. Or Sogno Gelato, the famous ice cream shop in a shopping mall in Tsuen Wan, which does not serve policemen; who, as a form of protest at the end of the year, sold his own creation, flavor direction tear gas, with black pepper.
On the Lennon Wall
The standards by which the shops are evaluated are constantly discussed in Hong Kong
Yeah. Has the owner spoken out in favour of government? Are the entrepreneurs demonstrably pro-Beijing? It hasn't been so easy to be part of a revolution for a long time if it just means buying the coffee in the right cafe. Dawn tells of people who were beaten up by policemen when they glued colorful post-its with wishes and demands to the so-called Lennon Walls, which were built all over Hong Kong on buildings, suburbs and business facades. Already 2014, during the umbrella movement there had been. Her example is in Prague, where a wall has been painted with graffiti and spelling since the 1960s as an expression of protest against the communist regime. "We do not know what can happen to us if we express our opinion publicly," says Dawn. "In the yellow economy we can feel free and safe."
Dawn worked as a social worker until mid-January. Night after night, she was on her way to homeless teens, runaways and drug addicts. The more intense the protests became, the more frequently they and their team with Minivan also served as revolutionary tactics. They quickly brought the young protesters out of the danger zone or home, when at some point at 22am no longer a subway was running. What she experienced and saw did not leave her untouched. She had a panic attack and couldn't sleep. She still has stomach problems today. Dawn's work was not without risk; at the wedding of the protests, the Hong Kong police also arrested first-aid workers and social workers.
Holiday in Australia
Before looking for a new job, she will travel: two weeks Australia in February. She'll be accompanying friends, nurses who see her vacation as a research trip. They want to find out if they can imagine a life in Australia. A little Dawn wants that, too.
Yeah. "Quite honestly," she says, "I do not want to have children here, because I could not guarantee them a good life, no democracy, no freedom and no possibility of doing what they want." "Rationally, we believe that emigration is the best thing for us. We just can't do it emotionally."
For Kelvin, emigration is also a realistic option. On the weekends he now learns again for his studies in order to have the best possible opportunities in another country with an early graduation. His parents, who think "yellow" like him, consider moving to Taiwan. Until then, the daily protest will be part of her life. "We are waiting for the right moment to overwhelm the Chinese government," says Kelvin. "We are always ready to go back on the road."
news_content_translate_cn:
从远处看，一切似乎都恢复了正常。“但现在一切都不正常了，”他说。一点也不。香港的抗议活动，在过去六个月里有焚烧路障和殴打世界各地警察的照片，变得越来越安静和罕见。他们没走，只是搬家了。开尔文最好别提他的真名。今年1月下旬，除夕夜的最后一个晚上，22岁的他正在去探亲的路上。
电话线很乱，“我在地铁上，”开尔文直截了当地说，好像是用棉线。他又戴了面具。但不是一个重的，对催泪瓦斯雾，而是一个轻的，对冠状病毒，找到了它的方式，香港。前一天，政府首脑林郑月娥宣布进入紧急状态。当地迪士尼乐园关闭，照片显示公共场所空置废弃，示威暂时不会举行。不过，如果香港政府不同意对来自中国大陆的游客完全封锁香港，公司可能会在周一对医生和护士进行罢工。
新年假期结束
事实上，元旦假期结束后，本该在周一返校的本应是本市学生。不过，林郑月娥星期五宣布，由于感染风险，这些学校将一直关闭到3月。“这座城市陷入恐慌，”凯文说。再正常不过了。但这不是他现在想要的。
香港董事总经理张马修（Matthew Cheung）去年12月曾承诺，2020年一切都将不同。开尔文苦笑。他很长时间不相信政治了。开尔文说他大约每周去一次最后的示威。当然，总会有暴力场面，警察继续采取暴力行动
是 啊。但真正的抗议不再发生在街头，而是发生在经济层面。近几个月来，示威者称之为黄色经济的东西已经发展起来，黄色经济。
在一种不断增长的在线注册中，商店、餐馆，甚至健身工作室都被称为黄色或蓝色。黄色意味着民主友好。蓝色：北京友好。“我很严格，”凯文说，“我不会花一分钱在那些冷血面对抗议的人身上。”这是革命的附带损害，普通员工也会受到影响，他们的合同被终止。他们就是这么说的。
重要的金融和商业空间
没有办法详细核实。但香港作为中国重要的金融和贸易场所，其经济显然受到了抗议的影响。林郑月娥警长不断警告数字不好。但如果这会吓到示威者，那就行不通了。如果对北京政府的经济压力不起作用，那又怎样？开尔文说：“你如何花钱就像在选举中投票一样。”同时，这也是一种低门槛的抗议形式。任何人都可以参加，而不必把自己置于危险之中。消费早已成为政治。下一个充满活力的策略是从其创作群体的深处发展起来的，这与这场抗议运动是吻合的。
李小龙六个月前的一句名言“做水，我的朋友”，一直是香港示威者的座右铭。2019年6月初，数十万人首次走上街头，抗议修改法律，允许毫无困难地将嫌犯和罪犯引渡到中国
是 啊。凯文12日首次以香港警察的身份出现在那里，当时香港警察强烈反对示威者。六月！这是早期的一个转折点，之后第一次和平抗议发生了根本性的变化。双方都配备了武器：警察配备了更多的催泪瓦斯、橡皮子弹、喷水器和棍棒；大多数年轻示威者都配备了燃烧弹和专业设备。街道成了战场，每周。
艰难的判断
开尔文这周在一家律师事务所工作。作为助理，他处理年轻示威者因持有武器而被定罪的案件。几个小时以来，他一直在看闭路电视录像，以便能够准确地说出发生在什么时候，比如在与警方发生口角时。他说他很高兴能做这项工作，即使这并不总是公平的。因为有些法官加快诉讼程序，以便迅速谴责人民；因为许多人，在怀疑中，总是选择更严厉的判决。他说：“上周，一名23岁的女孩因帮助一名示威者喝燃烧弹而被判12个月监禁。”
路透社（Reuters）最近撰文称，约有7000名老人在7个月的抗议活动中被捕。据警察局长唐英年（Chris Tang）称，已有1092人被定罪。九个人中的大部分。6月14日。据报道，2019年11月，囚犯年龄在21至25岁之间，其中大部分为男性。半年的抗议活动把北京分成了支持者和反对者，但也把家庭撕裂。冲突也是一代代之间的，年轻人思想发黄，祖父母思想发蓝。
害怕迫害
例如，23岁的道恩就是这样。出于对迫害的恐惧，她也没有提到自己的真名
是 啊。几个月来，中国一直在避免与忠于中国政府的亲属发生冲突。就像你80多岁的爷爷。只有大陆的亲戚才说服他相信他除夕夜的旅行计划。在此之前，他相信共产党已经控制了冠状病毒的爆发。她也去她家过年。因为亲戚们是从一家蓝餐厅点的菜，他们也从一家黄餐厅点的。这种厌恶依然存在，因为每个人都在谈论冠状病毒，而不是政治。她定期给父母寄去“许可”商店的名单。她说，有时候他们会坚持下去。对她来说，对开尔文来说，这不是问题。“我已经习惯了在进商店前看东西了。”她笑着对门口的蛇说，即使没有应用程序。
通过Whatsapp，Dawn发送了她使用的应用程序的链接。城市地图上有黄色、蓝色和一些红点。注意：中国大陆首都！薄扶林区的一家麦当劳被标为蓝色，一个有说明的窗口在点击后打开。包括25号的。2019年8月，向警察发放了代金券。大围的肉馅饼店是黄色的。业主们站在示威者一边。或是荃湾一家商场内著名的冰淇淋店，不为警察服务；而在年底，该店以抗议的形式，用黑胡椒出售自己创作的香精方向催泪瓦斯。
在列侬墙上
香港经常讨论评估商店的标准
是 啊。店主是否公开表示支持政府？这些企业家显然是亲北京的吗？如果仅仅意味着在正确的咖啡馆买咖啡，那么很长一段时间以来，成为革命的一部分并不那么容易。《黎明》讲述了一些被警察殴打的人，他们把写有愿望和要求的彩色柱子粘在所谓的列侬墙上，列侬墙是香港各地的建筑物、郊区和商业门面上建造的。早在2014年，雨伞运动期间就已经有了。她的例子是在布拉格，自20世纪60年代以来，布拉格的一堵墙就被涂鸦和拼写作为对共产主义政权的抗议表达。道恩说：“如果我们公开表达自己的观点，我们不知道会发生什么。”。“在黄色经济中，我们可以感到自由和安全。”
道恩一直做社工到一月中旬。一夜又一夜，她在去无家可归的青少年，逃亡者和吸毒者的路上。抗议活动越激烈，他们和他们的小货车车队就越频繁地充当革命策略。他们很快把年轻的抗议者带出了危险区或家，而在上午22点，地铁已经不在运行了。她所经历和所看到的并没有使她不受影响。她得了恐慌症，睡不着觉。她今天还是胃病。黎明的工作并非没有风险；在抗议活动的婚礼上，香港警方还逮捕了急救人员和社会工作者。
澳大利亚度假
在找新工作之前，她将旅行：2月份去澳大利亚两周。她将陪伴朋友和护士，他们把她的假期看作是一次研究旅行。他们想知道他们是否能想象在澳大利亚的生活。小道恩也想要。
是 啊。“老实说，”她说，“我不想在这里生孩子，因为我不能保证他们过上好日子，没有民主，没有自由，也不可能做他们想做的事。”“理性地说，我们认为移民对我们来说是最好的。我们只是在感情上做不到。”
对开尔文来说，移民也是一个现实的选择。在周末，他又开始学习，以便在另一个提前毕业的国家获得尽可能好的机会。像他一样认为“黄”的父母考虑移居台湾。在此之前，每天的抗议活动都将是她生活的一部分。“我们在等待合适的时机来压倒中国政府，”凯文说。“我们随时准备上路。”

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus cases in Wuhan may be nearing peak, study finds
news_title_translate_cn: 研究发现，武汉冠状病毒病例可能接近高峰
news_content_translate_en:
LONDON (BLOOMBERG) - The coronavirus may have infected at least 1 in 20 people in Wuhan, the Chinese city at the epicentre of the global outbreak, by the time it peaks in coming weeks, according to scientists modelling its spread. 
 The typically bustling megacity, where the so-called 2019-nCoV virus emerged late last year, has been in lockdown since Jan 23, restricting the movement of 11 million people. 
 Trends in reported cases in Wuhan so far broadly support the mathematical modelling the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine is using to predict the epidemic's transmission dynamics. 
 "Assuming current trends continue, we're still projecting a mid-to-late-February peak" in Wuhan, said Associate Professor Adam Kucharski, an infectious disease epidemiology expert in an email Sunday (Feb 9). 
 "There's a lot of uncertainty, so I'm cautious about picking out a single value for the peak, but it's possible based on current data we might see a peak prevalence over 5 per cent." 
 Health authorities in China and around the world are anxiously waiting to know whether the world's largest known quarantine has been effective in containing the pneumonia-causing virus in Wuhan and across other cities in Hubei province, the landlocked region of 60 million people. 
 Assoc Prof Kucharski, whose research focuses on the dynamics of infectious diseases, and colleagues have based their modelling on a range of assumptions about the virus. These include an incubation of 5.2 days, a delay from the onset of symptoms to confirmation of infection of 6.1 days, and the risk of infection among the 10 million people who have been identified as more vulnerable in Wuhan. 
 Based on that, a prevalence of 5 per cent equates to about 500,000 cumulative infections. That's many times more than the 14,982 cases provincial health authorities had counted in Wuhan as of 8pm Saturday
. 
 Researchers will gauge the proportion of people in the population who have been infected with virus after a test becomes available enabling them to conduct a so-called serosurvey to identify those whose blood contains antibodies produced in response to exposure to the virus. 
 Currently, the true number of people in Wuhan exposed to the virus "may be vastly underestimated," Dr Manuel Battegay and colleagues at the University of Basel in Switzerland said in a study published Friday. 
 "With a focus on thousands of serious cases, mild or asymptomatic courses that possibly account for the bulk of the 2019-nCoV infections might remain largely unrecognised, in particular during the influenza season." 
 Authorities in China have counted more than 37,000 cases - of which more than 800 have been fatal - over the past two months. That has surpassed the 774 fatalities from the 2002-2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome, or Sars, over eight months, according to the World Health Organisation (WHO). 
 In the first 17,000 or so cases, about 82 per cent are mild, 15 per cent severe and 3 per cent critical, the WHO said Friday. Of 138 patients admitted to Zhongnan Hospital of Wuhan University in the first four weeks of January, 26 per cent were placed in intensive care and 4.3 per cent died, a study in the Journal of the American Medical Association published Friday found. 
 While the fast-moving, infectious coronavirus has caused thousands of people to fall gravely ill and overwhelm hospitals, once researchers understand the full spectrum of illness associated with the virus, the overall case-fatality risk is likely to be much less than 1 per cent, said Dr Ian Lipkin, director of the Centre for Infection and Immunity at Columbia University's Mailman School of Public Health in New York. 
 People with mild or no apparent symptoms aren't currently being counted among cases, he told reporters Sunday
. A slowdown in the increase in reported cases over the past few days is "meaningful," according to Dr Lipkin, who recently returned to the US from China, where he was advising on the outbreak. He spoke with journalists during a 14-day home quarantine. 
 If measures taken so far to contain the outbreak are effective, some "dramatic reductions" in infections should be observed in the third or fourth weeks of February, he said. Warmer, early-spring weather might also impede transmission, he said. 
 Some studies indicate an infected person may not display symptoms for 14 days or more, with testing and confirmation of cases adding to delays. This will prolong the time it will take to identify whether China's unprecedented disease-control measures have worked. 
 "The next two weeks are really critical to understand what's been happening," said Dr Benjamin Cowling, head of epidemiology and biostatistics at the University of Hong Kong, in an interview in Melbourne on Thursday. 
 "And, is this going to spread into other locations, or have we avoided what could be a global pandemic because of the control measures that have been implemented to date?" 
 The number of cases reported in Wuhan and across Hubei province has been tracking downward over the past several days. 
 "There has been a stabilisation in the number of cases reported from Hubei, and we're in a four-day stable period where the number of reported cases hasn't advanced," Dr Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's Health Emergencies Programme, told reporters in Geneva Saturday. 
 "That's good news and may reflect the impact of the control measures that have been put in place." 
 There has been a "low, but steady incidence" of infections in places outside Hubei, Dr Ryan said. It's unclear which of those provinces may control the disease or where it might escalate, he said. 
 "We hope that the same stabilisation that appears to be occurring in Wuhan also occurs outside," Dr Ryan said
. "But, again it's very, very, very early to make any predictions about numbers." "This is still a very intense disease outbreak in Wuhan and Hubei, and there are still great risks in practically all of the other provinces, so we will wait and see," he said.

伦敦（彭博社）-根据模拟冠状病毒传播的科学家，冠状病毒在未来几周达到高峰时，可能已经在全球爆发中心的中国城市武汉感染了至少1/20的人。
这座通常熙熙攘攘的特大城市，即所谓的2019年nCoV病毒去年底出现的地方，自1月23日以来一直处于封锁状态，限制了1100万人的流动。
到目前为止，武汉报告病例的趋势广泛支持伦敦卫生与热带医学院用来预测流行病传播动态的数学模型。
传染病流行病学专家亚当·库查尔斯基副教授周日（2月9日）在一封电子邮件中说：“假设目前的趋势继续下去，我们仍预计武汉将出现2月中下旬的高峰。”。
“有很多不确定性，所以我对挑选峰值的单个值持谨慎态度，但根据目前的数据，我们可能会看到峰值患病率超过5%。”
中国和世界各地的卫生当局正焦急地等待着世界上最大的已知检疫是否有效遏制了武汉和湖北省其他城市的肺炎病毒，这是6000万人的内陆地区。
库查尔斯基教授，他的研究重点是传染病的动力学，和他的同事们建立在一系列关于病毒的假设的基础上。其中包括潜伏期为5.2天，从症状出现到确诊感染的时间推迟了6.1天，以及在武汉被确定为更易感染的1000万人中的感染风险。
在此基础上，5%的流行率相当于约50万例累积感染。这比上周六晚上8点武汉市省级卫生部门统计的14982例病例多了很多倍
.
研究人员将在检测结果出来后，对感染病毒的人群中的比例进行评估，使他们能够进行所谓的血清调查，以确定血液中含有因接触病毒而产生的抗体的人群。
瑞士巴塞尔大学的Manuel Battegay博士和他的同事在周五发表的一项研究中说，目前，武汉真正接触病毒的人数“可能被大大低估”。
“随着对数千例严重病例的关注，可能占2019年nCoV感染主要部分的轻度或无症状病程可能在很大程度上仍未被发现，特别是在流感季节。”
在过去的两个月里，中国当局统计了37000多起病例，其中800多起是致命的。根据世界卫生组织（WHO）的数据，这已经超过了2002-2003年8个月内爆发的严重急性呼吸系统综合症（Sars）的774例死亡人数。
世卫组织星期五说，在最初的1.7万例左右的病例中，大约82%是轻度的，15%是重度的，3%是严重的。上周五出版的《美国医学会杂志》（Journal Of the American Medical Association）的一项研究发现，1月前4周，武汉大学中南医院收治的138名患者中，26%接受了重症监护，4.3%死亡。
感染与免疫中心主任伊恩·利普金博士说，尽管这种快速传播的传染性冠状病毒已导致数千人重病，使医院不堪重负，但一旦研究人员了解了与病毒相关的全部疾病谱，总的病死率可能远低于1%在纽约哥伦比亚大学邮差公共卫生学院。
他星期天对记者说，目前还没有把症状轻微或没有明显症状的人列入病例
. 据利普金博士说，过去几天报告病例增长放缓是“有意义的”，他最近从中国返回美国，为疫情提供咨询。在为期14天的家庭隔离期间，他接受了记者采访。
他说，如果迄今为止采取的控制疫情的措施是有效的，那么应该在2月的第三或第四周观察到感染人数的“大幅减少”。他说，温暖的早春天气也可能阻碍传播。
一些研究表明，感染者可能在14天或更长时间内不会出现症状，对病例的检测和确认会增加延误。这将延长鉴定中国前所未有的疾病控制措施是否奏效所需的时间。
香港大学的流行病学和生物统计学负责人Benjamin Cowling博士星期四在墨尔本接受采访时说：“接下来的两周对了解正在发生的事情至关重要。”
“而且，这是否会蔓延到其他地区，或者我们是否已经避免了由于迄今已实施的控制措施而可能导致的全球流行病？”
过去几天，武汉和湖北省各地报告的病例数一直在下降。
世卫组织卫生紧急情况方案执行主任迈克·瑞安博士星期六在日内瓦对记者说：“湖北报告的病例数量已经稳定下来，我们正处于一个4天稳定期，报告的病例数量没有进展。”。
“这是个好消息，可能反映出已经出台的控制措施的影响。”
瑞安博士说，湖北以外地区的感染率“低，但稳定”。他说，目前还不清楚这些省份中的哪一个可能控制了这种疾病，或者在哪里可能会升级。
瑞安博士说：“我们希望武汉出现的同样的稳定也发生在外部。”
. "但是，现在对数字做出任何预测都非常、非常、非常早。“武汉和湖北的疫情仍然非常严重，而且几乎所有其他省份都存在很大的风险，所以我们将拭目以待，”他说。

news_title_translate_en: Wuhan virus: China chides ‘mean’ US for travel warning as virus impact spreads
news_title_translate_cn: 武汉病毒：中国指责美国因病毒影响传播而发出旅游警告
news_content_translate_en:
SHANGHAI/BEIJING (REUTERS) – The United States angered China on Friday (Jan 31) with a warning to Americans not to travel there because of a coronavirus epidemic that has rattled the global economy with increasing disruption to business supply lines. 
 Originating in the Chinese city of Wuhan, the flu-like virus first identified earlier this month has resulted in 213 deaths in China. Wuhan and the surrounding region are in virtual quarantine. 
 More than 9,800 people have been infected in China and more than 130 cases reported in at least 25 other countries and regions, with Russia, Britain, Sweden and Italy all reporting their first cases on Thursday or Friday. 
 “Do not travel to China due to the novel coronavirus first identified in Wuhan,” the US State Department said, raising the warning for China to the same level as Afghanistan and Iraq. 
 Beijing, which has only just started to mend tattered trade ties with Washington, responded sharply. 
 It noted the World Health Organisation (WHO) has commended Chinese containment efforts and not recommended travel or trade curbs. 
 “The World Health Organisation urged countries to avoid travel restrictions, but very soon after that, the United States did the opposite,” Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman Hua Chunying said. “It’s truly mean.” 
 Many other countries have also advised citizens to put off non-urgent travel to China. After reporting its first two cases of the illness, Russia on Friday restricted direct flights to China, its biggest trade partner. 
 Panama’s canal authority said vessels that had passed through countries where coronavirus had been confirmed had to report that to authorities. 
 Singapore, a major travel hub in Asia, stopped entry of passengers with a recent history of travel to China and also suspended visas for Chinese passport holders
. 
 With major fallout inevitable for China’s economy, which is the world’s second largest, global shares were heading for their biggest weekly losses since August on Friday. 
 The outbreak could “reverberate globally”, Moody’s said. 
 In the latest impact to big name corporations, South Korea’s Hyundai Motor said it planned to halt production of a sport utility vehicle this weekend due to a supply disruption caused by the outbreak. 
Sangyong Motor said it would idle its plant in the South Korean city of Pyeongtaek from Feb 4-12 for the same reason. 
 Home appliance maker Electrolux issued a similar warning. 
 French carmaker PSA Peugeot Citroen said its three plants in Wuhan will remain closed until mid-February. 
 After holding off as the crisis grew, the WHO said on Thursday that the epidemic did constitute a public health emergency of international concern, a designation that triggers tighter global containment measures and coordination. 
 However, WHO director-general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus reiterated in a series of tweets on Friday that his organisation had confidence in China’s capacity to control the 2019-nCoV virus. 
 “We would’ve seen many more #2019nCoV cases outside China by now, and probably deaths, if it were not for the government’s efforts and the progress they’ve made to protect their own people and the world,” he tweeted. 
 “Travel restrictions can cause more harm than good by hindering info-sharing and medical supply chains and harming economies. We urge countries and companies to make evidence-based, consistent decisions.” 
 The roughly 60 million residents of Hubei province, where Wuhan is the capital, have had movements curbed to try and slow the spread of the disease. But some people were leaving and entering the area by foot on a bridge over the Yangtze river, a Reuters witness said, and infections have jumped in two cities flanking Wuhan. 
 Wuhan’s Communist Party chief said the city should have acted earlier to contain the virus
. 
 China’s statistics show just over 2per cent of infected people have died, suggesting the virus is less deadly than the 2002-2003 outbreak of the severe acute respiratory syndrome (Sars). 
 But economists say its financial impact could be bigger than Sars, which killed about 800 people at an estimated cost of US$33 billion (S$50 billion) to the global economy, since China’s share of the world economy is now far greater. 
 The WHO has reported at least eight cases of human-to-human transmission – as opposed to people coming infected from China - in four countries: the United States, Germany, Japan and Vietnam. Thailand said it too had such a case. 
 Rising public alarm over the epidemic has brought a wave of anti-China sentiment abroad and led airlines to cancel or reduce flights, with airline crews pressuring carriers to act. 
 US carriers Delta Air Lines and American Airlines became the latest major airlines to suspend flights after the US travel advisory. 
 Governments around the world are evacuating citizens from Hubei. 
 A plane with 83 British and 27 foreign nationals landed in Britain on Friday, while the United States issued a quarantine order for 195 Americans evacuated to California this week. Japan, with 14 confirmed cases, has sent three flights to bring citizens home.

路透上海/北京1月31日电---美国周五（1月31日）向中国发出警告，警告美国民众不要前往中国，因为冠状病毒疫情已令全球经济动荡，企业供应线受到越来越多的干扰。
这种流感病毒起源于中国城市武汉，本月早些时候首次被发现，目前已在中国造成213人死亡。武汉及周边地区处于虚拟隔离状态。
中国已经有9800多人感染，至少25个其他国家和地区报告了130多例病例，俄罗斯、英国、瑞典和意大利都在周四或周五报告了第一例病例。
美国国务院说：“不要因为武汉首次发现的新型冠状病毒而前往中国，”并将对中国的警告提高到与阿富汗和伊拉克相同的水平。
刚刚开始修补与华盛顿破碎贸易关系的中国政府对此反应强烈。
报告指出，世界卫生组织（世卫组织）赞扬了中国的遏制措施，而不建议采取旅行或贸易限制措施。
中国外交部发言人华春莹说：“世界卫生组织敦促各国避免旅行限制，但很快之后，美国就采取了相反的行动。”。“真是卑鄙。”
许多其他国家也建议公民推迟非紧急前往中国的旅行。在报告了前两起病例后，俄罗斯周五限制了其最大贸易伙伴中国的直飞航班。
巴拿马运河管理局表示，经过冠状病毒已被证实的国家的船只必须向当局报告。
新加坡是亚洲一个主要的旅游中心，它停止了近期来华旅游的旅客入境，并暂停了中国护照持有人的签证
.
由于全球第二大经济体不可避免地面临中国经济的主要后果，全球股市星期五将迎来8月份以来最大的周跌幅。
穆迪说，疫情可能“在全球产生反响”。
韩国现代汽车（Hyundai Motor）表示，由于疫情造成的供应中断，该公司计划本周末停止生产一款运动型多用途车，这是对知名企业的最新影响
三勇汽车表示，出于同样的原因，将于2月4日至12日停产位于韩国平崎市的工厂。
家电制造商伊莱克斯也发出了类似警告。
法国汽车制造商标致雪铁龙（PSA-Peugeot-Citroen）表示，其在武汉的三家工厂将一直关闭到2月中旬。
随着危机的加剧，世界卫生组织（WHO）在拖延之后于周四表示，疫情确实构成了国际关注的公共卫生紧急情况，这一指定引发了更严格的全球遏制措施和协调。
不过，世卫组织总干事特德罗斯·阿德南姆·盖布雷耶苏（Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus）周五在一系列推特上重申，他的组织对中国控制2019年nCoV病毒的能力有信心。
他在推特上说：“如果不是政府的努力和他们在保护本国人民和世界方面所取得的进展，到目前为止，我们在中国境外还会看到更多的ා2019例NCov病例，可能还会有人死亡。”。
“旅行限制阻碍信息共享和医疗供应链，损害经济，弊大于利。我们敦促各国和公司做出基于证据的一致决定。”
武汉是湖北省的省会，湖北省大约有6000万居民，他们的活动受到限制，试图减缓疾病的传播。但据路透社的一名目击者说，一些人在长江上的一座桥上步行进出该地区，在武汉周边的两个城市，感染人数激增。
武汉市委书记说，武汉应该早点采取行动控制病毒
.
中国的统计数据显示，仅有超过20%的感染者死亡，这表明该病毒的致死率低于2002-2003年爆发的严重急性呼吸综合征（Sars）。
但经济学家表示，由于中国目前在世界经济中所占的份额要大得多，其金融影响可能比非典更大，非典造成约800人死亡，估计全球经济将为此付出330亿美元（500亿新元）的代价。
世卫组织报告了在美国、德国、日本和越南4个国家至少8例人传人病例，而不是来自中国的感染者。泰国表示也有这样的情况。
公众对疫情的警觉不断升温，在国外掀起了一股反华情绪，导致航空公司取消或减少航班，航空公司机组人员向航空公司施压，要求航空公司采取行动。
美国航空公司达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）和美国航空公司（American Airlines）成为继美国旅行咨询公司（US travel advisory）之后最新暂停航班的主要航空公司。
世界各国政府正在从湖北疏散公民。
一架载有83名英国人和27名外国侨民的飞机周五在英国降落，而美国本周发布了195名撤离到加州的美国人的隔离令。日本有14例确诊病例，已派出3架航班送公民回国。

news_title_translate_en: Wuhan virus: Chinese researchers select 30 drug candidates to fight novel coronavirus
news_title_translate_cn: 武汉病毒：中国研究人员选择30种候选药物对抗新型冠状病毒
news_content_translate_en:
BEIJING (XINHUA) - Chinese researchers have selected 30 existing drugs, biologically active natural products and traditional Chinese medicines which may have therapeutic effects on the novel coronavirus for further tests, according to the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS). 
 A joint research team of scientists from the Shanghai Institute of Materia Medica under the CAS and ShanghaiTech University is searching for drugs to combat the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV), which has claimed 106 lives and infected 4,515 people nationwide in China as of the end of Monday (Jan 27). 
 Researchers from ShanghaiTech University, led by Rao Zihe and Yang Haitao, revealed Sunday the high-resolution crystal structure of the viral main proteinase (Mpro) of the novel coronavirus. 
 The Mpro, which controls the activities of the coronavirus replication complex, is an attractive target for therapy. 
 Based on the 2019-nCoV Mpro study, the joint team screened the marketed drugs as well as databases for high potency compounds and for compounds from medicinal plants, and selected 30 candidates through a combination of virtual screenings and enzymology tests. 
 The candidates include 12 anti-HIV drugs like Indinavir, Saquinavir, Lopinavir, Carfilzomib and ritonavir, two anti-respiratory syncytial virus drugs, an anti-schizophrenia drug, as well as an immunosuppressant. 
 Some traditional Chinese medicines that may contain effective components against 2019-nCoV, such as Polygonum cuspidatum, are also on the list. 
 The researchers suggested these drug candidates be considered for the clinical treatment of pneumonia patients infected with 2019-nCoV. 
 The team will carry out further tests on these candidates to provide guidance for clinical studies and treatments of the novel coronavirus, said the CAS.

北京（新华）-中国研究人员已经选择了30种现有的药物，生物活性天然产物和传统中药，可能对新冠状病毒有治疗作用，以进一步测试，根据中国科学院（CAS）。
由中国科学院上海药物研究所和上海理工大学的科学家组成的联合研究小组正在寻找对抗新型冠状病毒（2019 nCoV）的药物，截至周一（1月27日）底，该病毒已在中国全国造成106人死亡，4515人感染。
由饶子河和杨海涛领导的上海理工大学的研究人员周日揭示了新型冠状病毒主蛋白酶（Mpro）的高分辨率晶体结构。
Mpro控制冠状病毒复制复合物的活性，是一个有吸引力的治疗靶点。
基于2019年nCoV-Mpro研究，联合团队筛选了上市药物以及数据库中的高效化合物和药用植物化合物，并通过虚拟筛选和酶学测试的组合选择了30个候选药物。
候选药物包括12种抗HIV药物，如Indinavir、Saquinavir、Lopinavir、Carfilzomib和ritonavir，两种抗呼吸道合胞病毒药物，一种抗精神分裂症药物，以及一种免疫抑制剂。
一些可能含有对抗2019年nCoV有效成分的中药，如虎杖，也在名单上。
研究人员建议，这些候选药物应考虑用于感染2019年nCoV肺炎患者的临床治疗。
中科院表示，研究小组将对这些候选病毒进行进一步的测试，为新型冠状病毒的临床研究和治疗提供指导。

news_title_translate_en: DGS assesses when it should repeat reviews to citizens who have arrived in Portugal from Wuhan
news_title_translate_cn: DGS评估何时应该对从武汉抵达葡萄牙的公民重复审查
news_content_translate_en:
The citizens, 18 Portuguese and two Brazilian citizens, who arrived in Portugal on Sunday evening repatriated from the Chinese city of Wuhan, epicenter of the outbreak of the new coronavirus that has already infected more than 17 thousand people and killed more than 300, are well and without signs of respiratory disease. The Directorate-General for Health is still assessing when they can be repeated for analysis.
The 20 citizens are distributed by Pulido Valente Hospital and Health Park (four returnees are at this facility) in Lisbon, and were visited earlier this Monday afternoon by the International Sanity Team, coordinated by the Directorate-General for Health (DGS). W
"There is currently no clinical evidence to report. Last night's atmosphere was quite tranquil after a long journey. From the standpoint of the general state, they're all fine. We are also making sure that aspects of comfort are improved. We know the facility isn't a hotel. There are aspects that are being completed, such as some supporting material such as books, newspapers and the Internet,"said the Health Minister at a press conference this Monday.
Health Director Grace Freitas supplemented clinical information: "None of the people have developed symptoms related to the new disease. There has been no fever, cough or respiratory symptoms." 20 citizens can live together as long as they wear masks and comply with the recommendations made by health professionals.
For the time being, the analyses carried out at the end of Sunday night, the results of which were known this Monday, were negative for the presence of the new coronavirus. But they can be repeated, although the moment at which this may happen is still under consideration.
The first action, she said, will be symptom observation. "The appearance of symptoms will cause repeat analysis
Yeah. All countries are learning from this new methodology. The virus was detected less than a month ago. There are countries that are conducting analyses at 48-hour and 72-hour intervals, some with symptoms and others only when quarantine is over. We are looking at the various hypotheses almost every day and will take a decision on the basis of what we think is best and what the other partner countries are doing,"he explained.
Grace Freitas also said that the DGS is counting on the cooperation of a group of experts and that it will be on the basis of the recommendation of this group that they will also take a decision on when to repeat the analyses. "We have not yet made a decision. Tomorrow [Tuesday] we will speak to the experts again and, according to the experts, we will decide the frequency of the analyses."
Should one of these people show any suspicious symptoms, the protocol that already exists will be triggered. The professional contacts the medical support line for validation of the case as a suspect, there will be collection of material for analysis and the person will be referred to the reference hospital. In the face of a positive case, if close contact has taken place with another of the masked returnees, it will be necessary to resume the quarantine cycle.
Questioned again on the issue of isolation and measures to be applied to other citizens from China, Mrs Marta Temido reminded us that legislation allows, in exceptional situations that do not occur, separation of persons in order to ensure the health of themselves and third parties.
"These are exceptional measures that are always dependent on some consideration, proportionality criteria and legislation; this is not the case, but we know that there are mechanisms that we have and will use if necessary to ensure that they are themselves placed in security situations, as well as the general community," explained the minister
Yeah.
Grace Freitas once again stressed that this group of citizens is special because it has been at least thirty days at the epicentre of a new disease and has therefore been treated with special measures. "These citizens are not the same as others who may come from China. That's why the Ministry of Health decided to treat them in a special way. Others who arrive at similar risk will receive similar treatment. For different risk, different treatment", the Director-General for Health pointed out.
Portugal currently has three reference hospitals for suspected cases of infection with the new coronavirus and two specialised ambulances for the displacement of these cases. The delay in moving a suspect case to St John's Hospital on Felgueiras led the Union of Emergency Technicians Pre-Hospitality to make several criticisms about the material made available in the ambulances, the means available elsewhere in the country and the information available.
Grace Freitas explained that in this first phase, whose level is of disease containment, it is necessary to have a "very restricted first-line service line, with a well-prepared laboratory and a very capable number of professionals". At this time he said that they were working with the National Institute of Health Dr. Ricardo Jorge (Insa) and the Regional Health Administrations already thinking of a second line of response with more laboratories, transport network and other hospitals involved.

Questioned as to the protocol at this time if a suspicious case appears, e.g. in the Azores or Madeira, the person responsible has indicated that the patient will be set to leave in a hospital unit in the autonomous region and if there is no laboratory capacity in the area, will be the biological sample to be sent to Lisbon for testing in the reference laboratory
Yeah. Insa President Fernando Almeida stressed that the institute works in network with other 20 national laboratories, including in the islands, and that everyone has the technology to carry out the tests.
Marta Temido added that an assessment is ongoing of what happened with the two suspicious cases that Portugal has already registered, one in Lisbon and one in Porto. "We already have all the time line collection and we will do a detailed internal analysis to see what went less well and evaluate measures to be taken."
The Minister added that she spoke to the INEM President this Monday about the need to reshape the information and material available to all partners working with him. And that this Tuesday there will be a meeting of the National Public Health Council to reflect on the response capacity of each entity.

news_title_translate_en: In China, the first foreign victim of the coronavirus died.
news_title_translate_cn: 在中国，冠状病毒的第一个外国受害者死亡。
news_content_translate_en:
A person of 60-year-old American nationality infected with the coronavirus died last Thursday at a hospital in the city of Wuhan. The information was released by the spokesman of the US embassy in China. The New York Times, citing two people close to the case, states that it will be a woman with other associated health problems.
The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs had already revealed that at least 19 foreigners had been infected in China without, however, specifying their nationality.
Japanese diplomacy also advanced the death of a Japanese citizen in Wuhan, affected by severe viral pneumonia, although in this case the presence of the coronavirus was not confirmed. The first person to die because of the new coronavirus outside China was a Chinese citizen in the Philippines, which followed a death in Hong Kong. This Friday will be the day when there have been more deaths associated with the coronavirus outbreak and 86 deaths have been reported.
China rose this Saturday to 722 dead and over 34 thousand infected with the balance of the pneumonia outbreak caused by a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV) detected last December in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province. In addition to the Chinese mainland and the regions of Macao and Hong Kong, there are cases of infection confirmed in more than twenty countries. In Europe, the number of confirmed cases was 31 last Thursday with new infections found in the United Kingdom, Germany and Italy.
news_content_translate_cn:
上周四，一名感染冠状病毒的60岁美国公民在武汉市一家医院死亡。这一消息是由美国驻华大使馆发言人发布的。《纽约时报》援引两名知情人士的话称，这将是一名有其他相关健康问题的女性。
中国外交部已经透露，至少有19名外国人在中国受到感染，但没有具体说明他们的国籍。
日本外交还推动了一名在武汉的日本公民死于严重的病毒性肺炎，尽管在本案中冠状病毒的存在没有得到证实。中国境外因新冠状病毒死亡的第一人是在菲律宾的一名中国公民，随后在香港死亡。本周五将是与冠状病毒爆发有关的死亡人数增加的日子，据报道有86人死亡。
中国本周六上升至722人死亡，超过3.4万人感染了去年12月在湖北省省会武汉检测到的新型冠状病毒（2019 nCoV）引起的肺炎爆发。除了中国大陆和澳门、香港地区外，还有20多个国家确诊感染病例。在欧洲，上周四确诊病例为31例，英国、德国和意大利发现新感染病例。

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus. People with Portuguese passports held on cruise are in good health
news_title_translate_cn: 冠状病毒。持葡萄牙护照乘船旅行的人健康状况良好
news_content_translate_en:
The Portuguese consul in Macao and Hong Kong said this Friday that the seven people with Portuguese passports detained on a cruise in Hong Kong due to the new coronavirus are in good health.
"We were told that all of them had been subjected to medical tests and until yesterday [Thursday], no health problems were detected, remaining in quarantine", wrote Paul Cunha-Alves in an e-mail sent to Lusa.
"The General Consulate arrived yesterday [Thursday] in contact with the company owning the cruise ship to which it asked for more information on the identity of the seven persons, awaiting an answer", the diplomat explained.
Paulo Cunha-Alves also stressed that the consulate already asked the company to provide the seven persons with Portuguese passports with the contacts of the Portuguese Consulate General in Macao and Hong Kong.
At a press conference on Thursday, the head of the Macao Center for Disease Prevention and Control Lam Chong said that if Portuguese passport holders are residents of Macao, the Hong Kong authorities will communicate with the authorities of the territory, otherwise "will communicate with the consular services" of Portugal.
There are still 15 Macao residents aboard the ship.
The Portuguese Consulate General estimates that there are 170 thousand Portuguese passport carriers among residents in Macao and Hong Kong. Of these, only about six or seven thousand will be expatriated.
The Consulate General of Portugal in Macao and Hong Kong can be reached by phone 00 853 2835 6660, Macau@mne.pt or via a message on the respective page of the social network Facebook.
More than three
.000 persons, between crew and passengers, were kept on the cruise ship in the port of Hong Kong for medical examinations after confirmation that three Chinese passengers, who had previously travelled on the vessel, were infected with the new coronavirus.
On Wednesday morning, a team of Hong Kong health authorities boarded the World Dream to carry out medical inspections of passengers 1.800 and 1.800 crew after the ship docked at the Kai Tak terminal in Kowloon, which arrived after being refused by the Taiwanese authorities.
China has today elevated to 636 dead and over 31 thousand infected the balance of the pneumonia outbreak caused by a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV) detected last December in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province (center), placed under quarantine.
In addition to the mainland of China and the Chinese regions of Macao and Hong Kong, there are other cases of infection confirmed in more than twenty countries. In Europe, the number of confirmed cases arrived on Thursday at 31, with new infections detected in the United Kingdom, Germany and Italy.
The World Health Organisation (WHO) declared in mid-January an international public health emergency, which presupposes the adoption of worldwide prevention and coordination measures.

news_title_translate_en: WHO places Angola among the 13th priority countries in Africa
news_title_translate_cn: 世卫组织将安哥拉列为非洲第13个优先国家
news_content_translate_en:
This Thursday, the World Health Organisation placed Angola among the 13 African priority countries in preparation for the new coronavirus, due to strong links with China, and sent kits to 29 laboratories on the continent.
"The WHO has identified 13 priority countries in the region, which, because of their direct links or large volumes of travel to China, need to be particularly vigilant about the new coronavirus (2019-nCoV)", is read in a communication from the organisation, which sets out, in addition to Angola, Algeria, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Mauritius, Nigeria, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda and Zambia.
"Since January 22, the WHO has received dozens of alerts regarding possible infections in 20 countries", announced the organisation, noting that "up to the beginning of the week there were only two laboratories, one in Senegal and one in South Africa, capable of testing samples and working together with the countries in the region".
Meanwhile, OMS experts are adding, four other countries have announced that they are already able to test samples and diagnose cases of Ghana infection, Madagascar, Nigeria and Sierra Leone, but the WHO will send "kits to 29 laboratories in the region, which will ensure that there is diagnostic capacity for the new virus and which may also lead to analyses of samples from neighbouring countries."
Treatment at the initial stage of infection is vital to prevent rapid spread of infection, which could overwhelm the fragile health systems in the region, alert the WHO.
China has today elevated to 563 dead and over 28 thousand infected the balance of the pneumonia outbreak caused by a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV) detected last December in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province (center), placed under quarantine.

news_title_translate_en: G7 countries will fix a new response to the new coronavirus
news_title_translate_cn: 七国集团国家将对新的冠状病毒做出新的反应
news_content_translate_en:
The G7 countries, which are among the most industrialized in the world, will be working together to respond to the new coronavirus that has emerged in China, announced today the German Health Minister, following a phone conversation with his US counterpart.
"We agree that there must be a telephone conference of the G7 Ministers of Health to find a'uniform'answer," explained Jens Spahn, at a time when the epidemic has already caused more than 300 deaths.
The group of the most industrialized countries in the world (G7) consists of Germany, Canada, the United States, France, Italy, Japan and the United Kingdom.
China raised to 304 today dead and over 14 thousand infected the balance of the pneumonia outbreak caused by a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV) detected last December in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province (centre).
The Philippines also today announced the death of a Chinese national who was a victim of coronavirus pneumonia, the first fatality victim outside China.
In addition to the mainland of China and the Chinese regions of Macao and Hong Kong, there are more cases of confirmed infection in 24 other countries.
The World Health Organisation (WHO) declared on Thursday an international public health emergency (PHEIC) because of the outbreak of the new coronavirus in China.
The plane that departed from Wuhan, a Chinese city quarantined by the new coronavirus, to remove European citizens, including 17 Portuguese, arrived in early afternoon in France.
The Ministry of Health will provide facilities where Portuguese people from Wuhan can stay in voluntary "prophylactic isolation". Pulido Valente Hospital in Lisbon and the Military Hospital in Porto will be the units to receive them.
news_content_translate_cn:

詹斯斯斯帕恩解释说：“我们同意，七国集团（G7）卫生部长必须召开一次电话会议，以找到一个‘统一’的答案。”。

news_title_translate_en: Coronavirus. Macao casinos close this Tuesday for two weeks
news_title_translate_cn: 冠状病毒。澳门赌场本周二停业两周
news_content_translate_en:
The Macao government announced this Tuesday that casinos will close as of midnight for two weeks in order to stem the outbreak of the new coronavirus, which has already infected ten people in the territory.
"We have decided from midnight tonight (16:00 in Lisbon), that 41 casinos, including theaters, cinemas, games rooms and discos, will be suspended for 15 days from midnight tonight", announced Secretary for Economic and Financial Affairs, Law Wai Nong, at a press conference.
The six concessionaires promised that they will not force their officials to take unpaid leave and that they will continue to pay during this period.
Hours earlier, the chief executive had already announced that casinos will suspend operations for two weeks following two more confirmed cases of the new coronavirus, one of them in a casino employee and the other a bus driver from the Macao Gaming Society, founded by gambling mogul Stanley Ho.
The responsible party assumed that it was a "difficult decision" and that it "will cause a lot of economic damage", but that "Macao can take that risk".

.400 infected with the balance of the pneumonia outbreak caused by a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV) detected last December in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province (centre), placed under quarantine.

news_content_translate_en:
This Thursday, the Council of the Portuguese Communities in Macao told Lusa that the Portuguese population in the territory is calm at home as a preventive measure to prevent the spread of the Chinese coronavirus outbreak.
"The majority of the Portuguese community is calm, serene, at home", he stressed.
People are calm, waiting for news. I believe that things will pass,"he added, who is also the only Portuguese deputy in Macao's Legislative Assembly (AL).
The councillor praised the exceptional measures enacted by the Macao Government, stressing that "they are being welcomed by the majority of Macao's population", namely "those relating to the temporary closure of casinos".
For Pereira Coutinho, "it was a wise move that the Chief Executive took, from shutting down temporarily for 15 days until further evaluation, [what] makes the Portuguese and local community serene.
The first case of infection of the new coronavirus in Macao has already been medically discharged, he told Lusa today the source of health services in the territory.
With this decision, Macao moves from ten to nine confirmed cases.
The Macao government has sent thousands of civil servants home, where they continue to work, but from a distance, another solution to address the dangers of the outbreak which began in a city in central China, Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province.
Macao closed the casinos and announced the closure of cultural and sporting spaces as well as all kinds of businesses, which is practically paralysing the economy.
Portugal's general consul in Macao and Hong Kong today told Lusa that the Portuguese in these two territories who are not working, due to the outbreak of the new coronavirus, may consider reviewing the family in Portugal
Yeah.
"Those who are not currently involved in a continuing professional activity may consider going to Portugal to se e family and friends," writes Paulo Cunha-Alves, in an e-mail sent to Lusa.
The diplomat also asked the Portuguese community "to remain calm and calm and to seek to follow clearly the advice and guidelines of local authorities, in particular health authorities, thus avoiding the risks of contagion".
In the same note, Paulo Cunha-Alves stressed that "any places of high public attendance should be avoided, and those who are exempt from work by the authorities and employers should be at home in the coming days".
Paulo Cunha-Alves added that the consulate has received "some requests for information and clarification", in most cases "related to travel documentation and some requests for advice on the position to be taken in the face of the current health crisis".

China has today elevated to 563 dead and over 28 thousand infected the balance of the pneumonia outbreak caused by a new coronavirus (2019-nCoV) detected last December in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province (center), placed under quarantine.

news_title_translate_en: European Union Ministers for Health at an extraordinary meeting on Thursday
news_title_translate_cn: 欧盟卫生部长周四在一次特别会议上
news_content_translate_en:
The European Union's (EU) health ministers are meeting at an extraordinary council next Thursday to discuss the development of the Chinese coronavirus, which has already infected 26 people in the Community area.
A European source told Lusa that this is an extraordinary meeting at the level of the Employment, Social Policy, Health and Consumers Council (EPSCO), which is held on Thursday morning in the Belgian capital, Brussels.
In the meantime, the Council of the EU has reported on this meeting in a statement stating that'the health ministers will exchange views and adopt conclusions on the new coronavirus outbreak'.
Portugal should be represented at the time by Mrs Marta Temido, Minister for Health.
Data from the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, consulted today by Lusa, indicate that so far 26 cases have already been recorded in the EU, most of them imported from China.
These are 13 cases in Germany (two imported, 11 locally acquired), six cases in France (five imported, one purchased locally), three cases in Italy (all imported), one case in Belgium (imported), one case in Finland (imported), one case in Spain (imported) and one case in Sweden (imported).
These cases in the EU were detected between January 25th and this Friday.
In addition to these three cases in the United Kingdom (three imported), a country which has since ceased to belong to the EU, but is still included in the data from this European health body.
All over, according to the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, 31.503 people have been infected with the new coronavirus worldwide and 638 deaths have already occurred.

一位欧洲消息人士告诉卢萨，这是周四上午在比利时首都布鲁塞尔举行的就业、社会政策、健康和消费者委员会（EPSCO）层面的一次特别会议。
与此同时，欧盟理事会在一份声明中报告了这次会议，声明称“卫生部长将就新的冠状病毒爆发交换意见并通过结论”。

其中德国13例（进口2例，当地获得11例），法国6例（进口5例，当地购买1例），意大利3例（全部进口），比利时1例（进口），芬兰1例（进口），西班牙1例（进口），瑞典1例（进口）。
